TITLE: Sr. PM, Event Technology - AMZ5838755
QUALIFICATIONS: BASIC QUALIFICATIONSPosition Requirements:Master's degree or foreign equivalent in Business Administration, Marketing, Engineering, or a related field and one year of experience in the job offered or a related occupation. Employer will accept a Bachelor's degree or foreign equivalent in Business, Marketing, Engineering, or a related field and five years of experience in the job offered or a related occupation as equivalent to the Master's degree and one year of experience. Must have one year of experience in the following skill(s): (1) managing event technology; (2) delivering cross functional/org technical projects; (3) developing or utilizing Strategic Meetings Management Platforms (SMMP), including registration/request management systems, mobile event applications, and other onsite tools (e.g. mobile check-in, RFID, etc.); and (4) managing virtual event/webinar/collaboration tools. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSPlease see the job description and position requirements above.Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONMULTIPLE POSITIONS AVAILABLECompany: AMAZON.COM SERVICES LLCPosition Title: Sr. PM, Event TechnologyLocation: Seattle, WashingtonPosition Responsibilities:Support the development of planning processes, integration and implementation of event technology for the global Amazon Business marketing team. Build virtual events that enable our worldwide marketing strategies. Deliver high-quality customer-facing events. Continually test, measure, and evolve event technology. Lead onboarding, integration, and execution of a broad event technology portfolio. Work cross-functionally with event teams to identify, scale, produce, and execute event technology solutions, including managing full-time and vendor/contractor resources. Manage technical implementation of virtual event hosting platforms and solutions used by event teams. Manage event live streams. Partner with event marketers to define metrics and develop registration and onsite management/reporting that gathers metrics from conception to reconciliation (including viewership data for virtual events and data flow integrations). Design and develop event microsite and registration platform templates, including but not limited to onsite check-in and mobile solutions. Work with program managers, business leaders, sales, internal/external tech teams, and key vendors to drive critical event technology initiatives related to virtual programs and content hosting. Research, evaluate, and recommend new technologies and technology vendors to support event needs.Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation. #0000

TITLE: Principal Program Manager, AWS Finance Technology
QUALIFICATIONS: 7+ years of program or project management experience 7+ years of cross functional project delivery experience 7+ years of managing, analyzing and communicating results to senior leadership experience 7+ years of working cross functionally with tech and non-tech teams experience Bachelor's degree Experience defining program requirements and using data and metrics to determine improvements Experience implementing repeatable processes and driving automation or standardization MBA Experience owning program strategy and end to end delivery Experience managing, analyzing and communicating results to senior leadership
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONJoin the team that is evolving how all of Amazon manages headcount! Work across VP organizations to drive adoption of the in-house built headcount management platform while collaborating with HR, Finance, and Business partners to develop and implement best practices.The AWS FinTech team is seeking a bright, self-driven, and collaborative Principal Program Manager to work with business leaders and teams to strategically shape headcount (HC) management, organizational design, and operations at Amazon.Headcount management at a global scale is complex, with multiple systems, mechanisms, and processes that, often do not provide the flexibility that individual teams or organizations require running their businesses. We are building the next gen headcount management system for the future and seeking a highly driven and collaborative program management professional to help us evolve the accompanying processes and mechanisms for effectively managing organization headcount. This will require working across teams that span multiple geographies to design, gain alignment, and execute on scalable HC management and tracking programs, as well as implementing new standards across different organizations within the company. This requires working effectively with global business owners at all levels in Commercial, Digital, and Other Amazon Businesses, Recruiting, Finance, HR, and other Amazon central teams to ensure the efficacy of our programs. This Principal Program Manager is detail-oriented, must have solid analytical skills, demonstrate strong project management skills, and the ability to gather business and technical requirements across teams to drive systems and change management processes. In addition, (s)he will partner with the different stakeholder groups to plan, deliver, test, deploy, and improve business solutions. This PM will need to roll up their sleeves, work independently, and have a high level of ownership, accountability, and interest in working collaboratively. Cross-team coordination, project management, and excellent communication skills are essential!Key job responsibilities•Partner with Amazon business teams to understand use cases, gather requirements, workforce planning and productivity mechanisms that satisfy each org’s custom needs and scale their needs with the business’ growth in volume, complexity, and global geographic dispersion.•Collaborate with program management peers, product/tech teams, and cross-functional customers to drive org adoption of Headcount Management system.•Represent the voice of the customer in developing new features or functionality within the system; prioritize between competing requests, understand and provide input on trade-off decisions, and develop change management strategies for evolving system functionality.•Develop a customer feedback intake and documentation process to monitor the voice of our customers. •Communicate program updates, SOP changes, and overall progress to leaders and cross-functional stakeholders.•Support large scale leadership re-organizations in the system based on business inputs.•Be a trusted advisor to internal customers; consult on HC management best practices and provide guidance on how to maximize usage of the system to provide value for the business.•Identify gaps and lead HC management projects where no single threaded owner is clear; unite various stakeholders to collectively address common pain points.A day in the lifeYou'll work with multiple personalities across Finance, HR, Consumer, Digital and Other Businesses, and Product team to bridge the gap between Tech solutions and the end users of the Headcount management platform. You'll work with leaders around the world to refine how their organizations utilize the platform, which will include leading training, data migration, and consulting on best practices to drive effective platform adoption. Whenever and wherever possible, you'll seek to align to a single source of truth for headcount data and eliminate manual processes and excel trackers, while taking every opportunity to make life easier for your customers.

TITLE: Senior Technical Program Manager, Storage & Memory Technologies
QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field 6+ years of experience in hardware development 6+ years of experience in storage systems or related field 4+ years of experience with development or qualifications of HDD, SSD or DRAM 4+ years of experience in technical project/program management Experienced in compute and storage server architecture and design for large scale applications. Experienced in delivering products against plan in a fast-paced, multi-disciplined, distributed-responsibility and often ambiguous environment Strong interpersonal and communication skills Strong writing skills
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAs a Senior Technical Program Manager, you will be leading the technical strategy and program management of AWS Infrastructure projects that will revolutionize industries across the globe. In this role, you will wear many hats. You must possess a unique combination of the hardware and design experience of a software development manager, together with customer and business acumen, and a do-what-it-takes approach to providing whatever is needed to make your program successful. You will need to be a strong leader, able to communicate clearly with conviction at all levels of the company. You don’t just want to be part of an industry movement; you want to be out front leading it. If this sounds like you, we’d like to speak with you. We are pioneering; come join us! We look for people who are capable and passionate in the following areas: Identifying and understanding opportunity, developing requirements, building roadmaps, and executing on business plans.Anticipating bottlenecks, providing escalation management and making trade offs; encouraging risk-taking behavior to maximize business benefit while identifying inter dependencies between concurrent projects to prevent downstream problems.Evangelizing within and outside Amazon to encourage a fast and smooth adoption of products and programs.Program leadership of computer systems, storage systems, storage devices, or related fieldExperience coordinating cross functional teams in both hardware and software engineeringExperience building processes, project management, and release schedules

TITLE: Amazon Robotics - Applied Scientist Co-op (Navigation Technologies) - 2023
QUALIFICATIONS: Currently enrolled in a PhD in Robotics, Engineering, or another similar field with a graduation date of August 2023 or later Must be eligible and available to work full-time (40 hours per week) in the United States for a 6-month internship 2+ years of relevant academic research or industry experience in developing algorithms and building models Depth and breadth in state-of-the-art approaches for at least one of robotics, Path Planning, computer vision or deep learning Ability to code algorithm prototypes independently and refine in simulation Working knowledge of analysis of algorithms and computational complexity Experience with programming languages such as Java, C++, and Python Experience solving business problems through machine learning, data mining and statistical algorithms Strong written and verbal communication skills Scientific mindset and the ability to invent Drive to see projects through from research concept to working production software Excellent creative problem solving skills Technical fluency; comfort understanding and discussing architectural concepts and algorithms, schedule tradeoffs and new opportunities with technical team members Publications at top-tier peer-reviewed conferences or journals Excellent critical thinking skills, combined with the ability to present your beliefs clearly and compellingly in both verbal and written form. Track record of thought leadership and contributions that have advanced their field A working knowledge of analysis of algorithms and computational complexity in transportation or traffic management systems
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAre you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers who work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling, and fun. Amazon Robotics empowers a smarter, faster, more consistent customer experience through automation. Amazon Robotics automates fulfillment center operations using various methods of robotic technology including autonomous mobile robots, sophisticated control software, language perception, power management, computer vision, depth sensing, machine learning, object recognition, and semantic understanding of commands. Amazon Robotics has a dedicated focus on research and development to continuously explore new opportunities to extend its product lines into new areas. Amazon Robotics internship/co-op/full-time opportunities will be based out of the Greater Boston Area in our two state-of-the-art facilities in Westborough, MA and North Reading, MA. Both campuses provide a unique opportunity to have direct access to robotics testing labs and manufacturing facilities.Key job responsibilitiesAs an Applied Scientist Co-op, you will work on projects related to autonomous coordinated path planning and problems in robotic field mapping. You will research the latest Academic literature in coordinated planning, brain storm different approaches with Applied and Research Scientists to solve real-world problems, and translate business and functional requirements into quick prototypes or proofs of concept.As an Applied Scientist Co-op, you will work from concept through to execution. This role will give you the opportunity to build tools and support services needed to analyze data, dive deep to resolve root cause of systems errors and changes, and present findings to business partners to drive improvements.About the teamThe Navigation Technologies team at Amazon Robotics is seeking interns with a passion for robotic research to work on cutting edge algorithms for robotics. Our team works on challenging and high-impact projects, including robotic field mapping, Multi-Agent coordinated planning of large fleets of robots, and complex navigation data services like obstacle detection, congestion detection and route estimations for large and complex Amazon Robotic sites. We are seeking internship candidates with backgrounds in computer vision, machine learning, path planning, simulation, discrete optimization, and robotics. You will be joining Research Scientists, Applied Scientists and software engineers working on challenging problems.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONJob summaryDo you have a strong machine learning background and want to help build new speech and language technology? Amazon is looking for Master's students who are ready to tackle some of the most interesting research problems on the leading edge of natural language processing. We are hiring in all areas of spoken language understanding: NLP, NLU, ASR, text-to-speech (TTS), and more!A successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, strong attention to detail, and the ability to work in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. As an Applied Science Intern, you will develop and implement novel scalable algorithms and modeling techniques to advance the state-of-the-art in technology areas at the intersection of ML, NLP, search, and deep learning. You will work side-by-side with global experts in speech and language to solve challenging groundbreaking research problems on production scale data. The ideal candidate must have the ability to work with diverse groups of people and cross-functional teams to solve complex business problems. Amazon fundamentally believes that scientific innovation is essential to being the most customer-centric company in the world. Please visit our website to stay updated with the research our teams are working on: https://www.amazon.science/research-areas/conversational-ai-natural-language-processing

TITLE: Amazon Robotics - Technical Program Manager Co-op - Spring 2023, Robotics Storage Technology (RST)
QUALIFICATIONS: Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree (or above) in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field Must graduate after September 2023 Must be eligible and available for a full-time (40 hours per week) co-op between January and June 2023 Experience with developing Gantt Charts and identify project critical paths Experience developing and executing against project schedules Experience communicating with technical and non-technical individuals Previous relevant internship or co-op experience Working towards Master’s (or above) degree in Engineering, Finance, or Business Direct Program or Project Management, or Technical Project Lead experience Ability to estimate project cost and return on investment Proficiency with MS Project, Asana, Jira, or similar project management tools Experience identifying, managing, and mitigating project risks Understanding of warehouse fulfillment operations, sortation and transportation logistics Experience in Robotics
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONJob summaryAre you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers who work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling, and fun. Amazon Robotics empowers a smarter, faster, more consistent customer experience through automation. Amazon Robotics automates fulfillment center operations using various methods of robotic technology including autonomous mobile robots, sophisticated control software, language perception, power management, computer vision, depth sensing, machine learning, object recognition, and semantic understanding of commands. Amazon Robotics has a dedicated focus on research and development to continuously explore new opportunities to extend its product lines into new areas. Amazon Robotics internship/co-op/full-time opportunities will be based out of the Greater Boston Area in our two state-of-the-art facilities in Westborough, MA and North Reading, MA. Both campuses provide a unique opportunity to have direct access to robotics testing labs and manufacturing facilities.Amazon Robotics is seeking a talented and motivated Technical Program Manager (TPM) Co-op who will be part of the Robotics Storage Product team focused on next generation robotic system design, as well as supporting the existing fleet of robotic and automation technology. The TPM Co-op will manage the full project lifecycle of innovative programs aimed at improving the efficiency and lowering the cost of Amazon’s next-generation Fulfillment Centers, Sortation Centers, Air Hubs, and Air Gateways. This position is responsible for the planning and execution of NPI and Sustaining programs while serving as liaison between Hardware Engineering, Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, Deployment Engineering, Solutions, Manufacturing and Supply Chain, Customer Support, and the Program Office. If you are a Technical Project Manager, Technical Program Manager, or Engineer looking to grow your skills in project and program management, with strong problem-solving skills, excellent communication skills, an ability to influence business and technical leaders in a dynamic environment with the desire to contribute to Amazon's next generation fulfillment technology, we want to talk with you. Joining our team provides the unique challenge and opportunity to build systems that benefit millions of customers and support sellers spanning the globe. The ideal candidate will draw upon exemplary program and project management, critical thinking, and problem solving skills, and a passion for creating reliable and maintainable systems. The candidate should be open to new challenges, strong at multi-tasking, innovative, creative, self-directed and a great team player. Candidate should drive continuous process improvement, and collaborate effectively with cross-functional operational and development teams to solve problems and implement new solutions.Key job responsibilitiesLead the effective and efficient delivery of Hardware projects, working closely with mechanical, electrical and embedded systems teamsInteract with Deployment Engineering, Manufacturing, Global Support Services, and other key stakeholders to define and deliver to project goals to improve performance, reduce cost, and reduce installation cycle timeDrive consensus on technical decisions and ensure the appropriate resources are employed to deliver high quality resultsIdentify, assess, track and mitigate issues and risks at the project levelCreate, maintain and disseminate project information to stakeholdersDrive effective teamwork, communication, collaboration and commitment across multiple disparate groups with competing prioritiesDevelop and drive hardware project schedulesDrive programs across all HW disciplines including Mechanical, Electrical, Firmware, Safety, Regulatory, HW Test EngineeringPartner with groups external to Hardware Engineering to successfully deliver on project goalsAbout the teamRobotics Storage Technology (RST) is a cross-functional organization chartered to design and deliver Amazon Robotics products for inventory storage and retrieval. We are composed of Analytics, Hardware, Software, Solutions, Product Management, and Program Management teams focused on existing and future technologies used by Amazon’s Global Customer and Global Specialty Fulfillment. The Product and Program team within RST works across technical teams in Industrial Design, Hardware Engineering, and Program/Product Management, as well as downstream execution teams such as Supply Chain, Operations, Finance, and Deployment Engineering to implement efficient collaboration and scaling mechanisms and support Amazon Robotics growth.

TITLE: Director, Applied Science - PXTCS, PXT Central Science
QUALIFICATIONS: BASIC QUALIFICATIONS• Advanced degree (e.g., M.S. or PhD) in computer science, statistics, engineering, mathematics or relevant discipline.• Experienced leader of leaders, with 10+ years of experience managing multiple science and/or engineering teams.• 10+ years of experience building and applying ML models to solve complex problems for large-scale applications.• Experience with leadership of experienced scientists as well as a record of developing junior members from academia/industry to a career track in a business environment.• Familiar with programming languages such as C/C++, Java, Perl or Python.• Combination of deep technical skills and business savvy enough to interface with all levels and disciplines within our customer’s organization.• Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively advocate technical solutions to research scientists, engineering teams and business audiences.• 8+ years of people management experience. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS• Ability to work in a fast-paced business environment.• Experience implementing algorithms, tailored to particular business needs and tested on large data sets.• Strong research track record.• Practical experience developing large-scale decision support tools based on optimization technology for planning and execution support.• Experience working on recommender systems or personalization within e-commerce, advertising, or other related fields. DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONThe Central Science Team within Amazon’s People Experience and Technology org (PXTCS) uses economics, behavioral science, statistics, and machine learning to proactively identify mechanisms and process improvements which simultaneously improve Amazon and the lives, well-being, and the value of work to Amazonians. We are an interdisciplinary team, which combines the talents of science and engineering to develop and deliver solutions that measurably achieve this goal. As Director for PXT Central Science Technology, you will be responsible for leading multiple teams through rapidly evolving complex demands and define, develop, deliver and execute on our science roadmap and vision. You will provide thought leadership to scientists and engineers to invent and implement scalable machine learning recommendations and data driven algorithms supporting flexible UI frameworks. You will manage and be responsible for delivering some of our most strategic technical initiatives. You will design, develop and operate new, highly scalable software systems that support Amazon’s efforts to be Earth’s Best Employer and have a significant impact on Amazon’s commitment to our employees and communities where we both serve and employ 1.3 million Amazonians. As Director of Applied Science, you will be part of the larger technical leadership community at Amazon. This community forms the backbone of the company, plays a critical role in the broad business planning, works closely with senior executives to develop business targets and resource requirements, influences our long-term technical and business strategy, helps hire and develop engineering leaders and developers, and ultimately enables us to deliver engineering innovations.This role is posted for Arlington, VA, but we are flexible on location at many of our offices in the US and Canada.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAs cloud technologies continue to transform businesses, skilled individuals are in high demand. At AWS Training and Certification (T&C), we are passionate about revolutionizing the way people advance their cloud skills and careers. We equip diverse builders of today and tomorrow with the knowledge they need to leverage the power of the AWS Cloud. Join our dynamic, fast-growing team and help us empower our customers to build cloud skills.Here's your chance to work as a Senior Business Development Manager on our Training & Certification team to meet the growing demand for Amazon Web Services (AWS) training around the globe. We need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. This is a new and highly visible position which will have significant customer impact. If you have a passion for learning, and believe you can compel customers to take advantage of our training and certification services to advance their stage in the AWS migration journey, we’d like to speak with you.In this role, you will work closely with our global T&C BDM teams, our product teams, and account managers to help their customers build AWS skills at scale. You will develop and close a robust pipeline by working with customers and partners to understand their training strategies and challenges, developing detailed proposals and helping customers with execution of certification plans. We are looking for an exceptionally strong analytical thinker who thrives in fast-paced, initially unstructured environments to define, develop and help execute a go to market plan, make refinements while learning and consistently deliver on revenue targets. The ideal candidate will possess a technical background that enables them to help drive engagement at both the user and CXO level. The right candidate will have very strong communication skills to skillfully create & articulate compelling value propositions around AWS.Travel up to 50% will be required. This role can be performed near any US AWS office in the following cities: Arlington, Atlanta, Austin, Ballston, Boston, Chicago, Cupertino, Dallas, Denver, Detroit, East Palo Alto, Herndon, Houston, Irvine, Minneapolis, New York City, Pittsburgh, Portland, San Diego, San Francisco, Seattle, Washington D.C., Tempe, Sunnyvale, or Santa Monica.The key responsibilities of the position include:Align priorities with sales leadershipEnable account teams and customersDevelop sales strategies with account teamsConduct needs assessments with customersDevelop detailed solutions and proposals to accelerate the adoption of AWS servicesEvangelize AWS Training & Certification at company and industry eventsBuild & maintain a pipeline of training opportunities and provide regular forecastsPrepare and deliver business reviews to senior managementGlobal responsibility for digital sales targets, creation of KPIs, and strategy for digital sales within the existing Training and Certification portfolio.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon Web Services (AWS) is growing rapidly, and we are looking for an Infrastructure Delivery Manager to join our expanding Infrastructure Operations team. AWS is a fast paced technology company and a leader in the world of data centers. We are currently looking for a proven technology manager with experience in people management, robust technical understanding and the drive and vision to take AWS Data Center Operations to the next level. The successful candidate for this role will create sustainable processes and standards; and drive automation opportunities to reduce delivery cycle times and to improve quality without impacting network availability.The mission of the team is to deliver network capacity on time with zero rework. The Infrastructure Delivery Manager will manage the implementation and delivery of inbound capacity and equipment. This manager will be responsible for a growing a team and will oversee their development and growth. The successful candidate will have experience managing and mentoring people, tracking budgets, providing strategic direction and proposing technical solutions. This manager will ultimately be responsible for installing and delivering our network equipment and related infrastructures, as well as responsible for driving low voltage structured cabling across the Amazon data center platform. Key job responsibilitiesSome high level responsibilities include: · Prioritize and assign tasks to data center technicians and operators· Manage inbound hardware installation from receiving through deployment stages · Manage the installation of cabling infrastructure in a data center environment · Guide, train and educate staff on the best practices related to all service owner issues · Manage tasks and deliverables across small to large-size projects · Recommend, document, and oversee policies and procedures to meet industry best practices and to meet required SLAs · Provide weekly reporting to the data center managers· Coordinate team resources to support project and delivery needs, to include emergency projects, change management and maintenance window support, and potential off-hours and on-call needs. · Recruit and train data technicians to ensure appropriate staffing levels · Host weekly staff meetings · Drive compliance to Amazon performance management requirementsAbout the teamThis role requires managers to conduct in person safety inspections, meetings, and operational tasks across Sterling/Ashburn data center locations. Attendance in person at weekly regional manager staff meetings at AWS corporate locations (Herndon, VA) may be required.

TITLE: Solutions Architect, National Security , NatSec Partner SA Team
QUALIFICATIONS: 3+ years of design, implementation, or consulting experience in applications or infrastructures 8+ years within specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics) 2+ years of design, implementation, or consulting in applications and infrastructures experience 4+ years of specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics) experience 2+ years of specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics) experience
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONJob summaryAmazon Web Services is seeking a Senior Solutions Architect to support our Intelligence Community customers in the Maryland, Northern VA + Washington, DC area. Please note: this position requires the candidate selected be a US Citizen and must currently possess an active Top Secret security clearance. The position further requires that, after start, the selected candidate obtain and maintain an active TS/SCI security clearance and satisfy other security related requirements.As a Solutions Architect on AWS National Security Partner Team, you will serve as a trusted technical advisor to AWS partners supporting the Intelligence Community – you are the “face of Amazon” to our partners who will engage you regarding a broad variety of technical challenges which are not just complex, but mission-critical. You will regularly collaborate with, and influence, both external stakeholders (our partners and government customers) and internal AWS teams like sales and platform engineering. On our team, you have the opportunity to “think big” as you design and architect advanced cloud-based solutions that meet your customer’s business and technical needs.Our Solutions Architects are regarded as technical “thought leaders” within the Intelligence Community who evangelize emerging technologies not only on a conceptual level, but also on a practical, architectural level. Our SA’s play a critical role in the widespread adoption and advancement of cloud computing capabilities within the Intelligence Community. They think outside of the box to deliver results to our partners and provide solutions that are cost-effective, mission-focused, and secure. On our team, you will work backwards from our customers' and partners’ goals to migrate complex workloads to the AWS cloud. This is a partner-facing position where you will provide exceptional technical design and thought leadership while working with a world class sales and business development team. In this role, you will get excited about educating, training, designing, and building cloud solutions for a diverse and challenging set of Intelligence Community customers and partners. You will build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within partner organizations to enable them to be cloud advocates. You will regularly take part in deep-dive education and design exercises to create world-class solutions built on AWS. You will partner with the sales team to formulate and execute a sales strategy to achieve sales goals through the adoption of AWS and be the primary "technical advisor" to the sales process, ensuring success in building and migrating applications, software and services on the AWS platform. You will also author or contribute to AWS customer-facing technical publications such as whitepapers, blogs, and other reusable content and educate customers of all sizes on the value proposition of AWSHere at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.We're dedicated to supporting new team members. Our team has a broad mix of experience levels and Amazon tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.Key job responsibilitiesAs a National Security Solutions Architect within AWS, you will have the opportunity to architect AWS solutions using a broad set of technologies and services (e.g., Amazon Lambda, Amazon S3, Amazon EC2, and SageMaker) directly with our community of systems integrators, consulting and technology partners. You will collaborate with AWS teams and experts on topics such as AI/ML, High Performance Computing, Storage and Container. Your broad responsibilities will include: owning the technical engagement and ultimate success around specific implementation projects; defining implementation architectures, responding to RFPs, developing a deep expertise in the AWS technologies as well as broad know-how around how applications and services are constructed using the AWS platform; and being a subject matter expert on security as it relates to customer applications and services.

Demonstrated experience building large-scale architectures involving public cloud platforms and on-premises technologies to meet business requirements Knowledge of cloud technologies in the areas of operational management, high availability, disaster recovery, security, and risk/compliance frameworks Automotive Industry experience with automotive solutions in areas like Product Engineering, Autonomous Vehicles, Supply Chain, Connected Mobility and Sustainability
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONCome build the future with us! Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for experienced and motivated technologists who possess a unique balance of technical depth, business acumen, and strong interpersonal skills. In this role, you will love what you do and instinctively know how to make work fun. You will be dynamic, creative, and willing to take on any challenge. You will make a big impact through your passion for educating, designing, and building cloud solutions across a diverse portfolio of technologies. Your understanding of large-scale computing solutions, enterprise technology adoption patterns, and past experience with cloud technologies will allow you to regularly engage in deep-dive discussions and design exercises to create world-class solutions. You will enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and developing new ones in this fast-paced environment.As a trusted customer advocate, the Senior Global Solutions Architect (SA) will develop the technology strategy for a large global enterprise customer in a complex and multi-faceted environment. You will interface with both senior executive leaders and cloud architects on a daily basis to build relationships and educate. You will help the customer design advanced cloud-based solutions, implement cutting-edge technologies, adopt cloud best practice designs, and migrate existing enterprise workloads to the cloud. You will partner with various AWS teams to craft highly scalable, flexible and resilient cloud architectures that solve customer business problems, build mindshare, and accelerate the adoption of AWS services. In collaboration with the sales team, you will drive customer satisfaction and revenue growth across a wide portfolio of industries.The ability to connect technology with measurable business value is a critical skill for the SA role. You should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business challenges and articulate technical solutions to solve those problems. As part of the broader SA community, you will capture and share best practices with your peers, generate internal and external technical content, and participate in hiring activities to grow the community. You will also be adept at interacting, communicating and partnering with other teams within AWS such as partners, services teams, marketing, and professional services, as well as representing your team to executive management.This role will require domestic/international travel for approximately 25% of the timeHere at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.About the teamOur team puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONNOTE: By applying to this position, your application will be considered for all locations we hire for in the United States including but not limited to: Arlington, VA.Are you a motivated technologist with a unique blend of curiosity, technical chops, and strong interpersonal skills? Do you want to help us build new things and evangelize use of AWS with customers? Do you enjoy being a guiding force, enabling customers to use best practices and design their applications and platforms for the cloud?The solutions architects (SA) organization is a diverse team that focuses on helping customers build infrastructures and applications at scale using AWS solutions. We are passionate about technology and relish the chances to dive deep and wide within the AWS platform in our quest to delight customers. As an SA intern, you will receive AWS technical training, immerse yourself in cloud computing concepts, have the opportunity to develop business acumen, and learn more about Amazon culture. You will work on projects with mentors and fellow interns, begin your professional AWS certification journey with Cloud Practitioner, and attend professional development events hosted by tenured Amazonians.Upon successful completion of the internship program, select interns will receive a full-time offer to join as a solutions architect associate (which includes a six-month residency training program, known as AWS Tech U) in 2023/2024, after completion of their degree program.Come build the future with us.Amazon internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks, starting May/June 2023. TITLE: Sr. Technical Program Manager, AZoth Backend Teams (Games)
QUALIFICATIONS: 5+ years of professional experience in project management of game development, game server/cloud or licensed game development technology. At least one released game or licensed game technology SDK on which you were a primary contributor. Great communication skills and ability to work effectively on shared projects with engineers, designers, artists, testers, and other developers. Experience managing more than one scrum/agile software development team simultaneously. PMP, PMI-ACP certification or Certified Scrum Master Experience managing teams working with videogame development engine level systems (rendering, audio, streaming, physics, etc), cloud infrastructure/services or DevOps, or equivalent licensed game development technologies. Experience in managing the development of large scale game worlds and/or game world content creation tools Technical Program Management background (CS degree or equivalent engineering experience)
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon Games is looking for a talented and driven senior Technical Program Manager that will maintain and uphold the "AZoth" core development technologies for our studio videogame titles. This person will partner primarily with engineers to build the tools, technologies and cloud services that are foundational to the game experiences built on top of them. They will own weekly planning and multi-month schedules and initiatives across multiple scrum teams; always looking for opportunities for process and organizational improvements that increase efficiency and raise quality. They will utilize their communication skills to effectively collaborate and influence their peers and executives resulting in the delight of the customers. They will work closely with multiple software development managers to guide the work of several core technology engineers.Join us in creating and extending our studio's "AZoth" game technology for our hit PC title New World and beyond. Our proprietary technology is 100% owned-and-operated exclusively by our team in support of our Amazon Games games and customers. You will be joining a group of talented and passionate technologists who are developing and improving our game backend tech to meet the ever-growing needs of our player customers, our game developers, and new game ideas. We are looking for natural problem solvers with a passion for gaming, enjoys finishing projects in a timely manner, and is a constant advocate for continuous improvement of our technology and services.Key job responsibilitiesProject manage three teams of engineers creating game Server infrastructure, game Services, and DevOps tools that allow our content teams to make amazing games.Fulfill the role of project manager for your teams using task management software and scheduling techniques that are a blend of agile development methods.Partner with technical leads (SDMs) to maximize the productivity of their engineers while helping to inform and guide development towards helping our game development partners make cool stuff. Assist in the development and maintenance of on-call rotations for engineers.Coordinate with partner teams in product gameplay and games publishing to deliver the right end-to-end customer experience in line with their release schedules.Generate documentation, schedules, reports that help make reasonable and firm development commitments for the team, whilst over-delivering on expectations wherever possible.Assist in creating the long-term development roadmap for your teams as they work on delivering multi-year improvements to our game products and gameplay development customers.Obsess about the games our technology is fueling, and participate in quality control over development in area of ownership, working with senior developers in all crafts.Partner with QA experts to ensure all issues are known and quickly resolved.About the teamThe "AZoth Backend Team" has a primary development hub in Irvine, CA; we also have satellite studios in San Diego, CA and Seattle, WA. Come join our teams at one of these locations!At Amazon, we believe in ground-breaking games that can redefine the boundaries of player experience. Come work alongside talented industry veterans, including key contributors from dozens of titles including Overwatch, World of Warcraft, Evolve, Gears of War, Killer Instinct, God of War.Inclusive Culture, Work/Life Balance, & Career GrowthWe embrace our differences and are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We offer ten employee-led affinity groups with 190 global chapters, innovative benefits, and annual and ongoing learning experiences (including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences). Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance and offers flexible working hours. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. Additionally, our team is dedicated to supporting you with mentorship and pathways for ongoing development. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and are building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and promotes career choice.

QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s or an advanced degree in supply chain, business, engineering, finance or related technical or quantitative field 10+ years of strategic sourcing or procurement of hardware 5+ years of Business development and/or product management experience 5+ years of technology experience in DRAM devices 3+ years of experience with data analysis tools such as Excel, Pivot Tables, SQL, Tableau, etc. Technical knowledge and market expertise in DRAM technologies. Experience influencing technical teams Advanced Engineering degree and/or MBA Experience in Technology Sourcing Ability to communicate clearly and drive a high level of focus and excellence with a strong and talented team.
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon Web Services (AWS) provides a highly reliable, scalable, and low-cost cloud platform that powers thousands of businesses in over 190 countries. AWS’ Infrastructure Supply Chain & Procurement (ISCaP) organization works to deliver cutting-edge solutions to source, build and maintain our socially responsible data center supply chains. We are a team of highly-motivated, engaged, and responsive professionals who enable the core sustainable infrastructure of AWS. Come join our team and be a part of history as we deliver results for the largest cloud services company on Earth!Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a highly effective candidate to identify, create, develop and integrate innovative technology to deliver the best operating, lowest cost infrastructure in the world. This individual will lead the sourcing strategy of our memory commodity that best meets our customers' rapidly growing infrastructure needs. Successful candidates will bring strong knowledge of DRAM/SSD Semiconductor supply chains and proven ability to manage complex negotiations, program manage cross-functional teams, and effectively operate at any level of the organization (up to senior executives). AWS serves over a million active customers in more than 190 countries. We are steadily expanding global infrastructure to help our customers achieve lower latency and higher throughput. As our customers grow their businesses, AWS will continue to provide infrastructure that meets their global requirements.Professional traits that are necessary for Amazon leaders:Exhibits excellent judgmentHas high standards (is never satisfied with the status quo)Is able to dive deep and is never out of touch with the details of the businessExpects and requires innovation of her/his teamHas passion and convictions and the innate ability to inspire passion in othersStrong results orientationThinks bigKey job responsibilitiesDevelop and implement cross functional commercial sourcing strategies for AWS hardware infrastructure.Understand industry and technology trends.Identify key technology trends in the industry and drive supplier product roadmaps and execute on strategic initiatives in those products.Negotiate and implement complex supplier agreements and contracts by working with cross-functional stakeholders.Develop negotiations strategies to deliver against business objectives and achieve sustainable relationship with suppliers.Responsible to provide weekly core-team updates, deliver executive level updates on a monthly basis, and will be responsible for vendor escalations in order to resolve any issues related to his/her category.Present to senior leadership via written narratives.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon is seeking a talented, highly motivated and experienced individual to join the Payment Acceptance & Experience team, which is responsible for enabling customers globally to pay for services with their preferred payment methods. As part of the Strategic Payments Partnership team the Sr. Partner Manager manages the strategic engagement between Amazon and the global payment partner at the executive level and drives the execution of those strategies through teams at both the partner and Amazon. The role will entail concurrently driving multiple initiatives that may involve commercial, marketing, product, and technology components across a broad spectrum of businesses and geographies; including negotiation for unconventional deals which have broad implications across multiple Amazon business units. It is crucial for the candidate to be forward-thinking and capable of illustrating the benefits of new payments innovations with our partners. This key role will be highly visible at the most senior levels of Amazon. You will need to work collaboratively with internal management teams to understand our relative advantages and risks, know when major features are in existing roadmaps, and current payment industry trends around innovation, consolidation and customer adoption. The ideal candidate will possess a strong business development and a background in credit and debit cards, payments, financial services, with significant experience in e-commerce. The candidate should have demonstrated experience engaging senior-level executives in past roles, and a credible understanding of the overall payment ecosystem. You will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the skill-set to drive tactical execution of sales and business development goals. Specific responsibilities include the following:·Create strategic business development plans and ensure these plans are in line with the overall Amazon Consumer Payments strategy·Execute the strategic business development plans while working closely with internal stakeholders including finance, product & technology, legal, operations and customer service teams·Evaluate the economic and strategic cost-benefit of new opportunities·Support the strategic objectives and interests of Amazon’s business teams on a global basis

TITLE: Cloud Support Associate Intern (Japanese Fluency)
QUALIFICATIONS: BASIC QUALIFICATIONS• A bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent technical discipline with a conferral date between December 2023 and August 2024• Fluency in Japanese and English PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS• Technical knowledge in systems administration, networking, programming, database, bigdata, analytics, mobile app development, and/or container services • Interest in learning cloud/distributed computing technology • Knowledge of the software development or Internet industries • Interest in learning full application stacks from the OS up to custom applicationsAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $23.85/hr in our lowest geographic market up to $60/hr in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon Web Services (AWS) is the market leader and technology forerunner in cloud services. Our Cloud Support team provides technical support to our customers across the globe. We are looking for technical interns to help accelerate our growing Cloud Support business. This is an excellent opportunity to join one of Amazon’s technical teams, working with some of the best and brightest engineers, while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies.What you will do: The Cloud Support Associate Internship is a training program for the Cloud Support Associate role. Interns in this program benefit from the opportunity to gain experience with AWS cloud services including EC2, load balancers, and S3 storage solutions. They collaborate with AWS engineers and their peers in a virtual classroom to learn about AWS services and practice troubleshooting techniques. You’ll have an opportunity to apply your new skills through customer case simulations.Amazon internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks, starting May-June 2023. Applicants should have at a minimum one quarter/semester remaining after their internship concludes, with a graduation date between December 2023 and August 2024.Key job responsibilities• Learn to use groundbreaking technologies• Develop advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide unique solutions to our customers• Interact with leading engineers around the world• Leverage customer support experience to provide feedback with AWS teams on how to improve• Work on a summer project that could improve support-related processes for our customersA day in the life• First and foremost, this is a customer support role – in the Cloud• You will work on learning about troubleshooting techniques to provide solutions for our customers • We have training programs to help you develop the skills required to be successful in your role. We hire smart people who are keen to build a career with AWS, so we are more interested in the areas that you do know instead of those you haven’t been exposed to yet

TITLE: Head, Game Production in the Cloud Solutions & BD , Game Tech
QUALIFICATIONS: 5+ years of professional or military experience Experience working in technology or games industry Business Development, Creative, Production, or Game Development A passion for games Experience working with game publishers, developers, retailers, distributors, and studios Experience working with enterprises, innovation centers and digital initiatives of organizations Proven leadership, problem solving and strong attention to detail Project management skills and experience working with cross-functional, international teams Experience and familiarity with cloud technologies Experience and familiarity with key games software, middleware, and platform tooling Experience with common games industry funding mechanisms, regional trade associations, regional institutions, and regional communities for game developers
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONThe games industry lives at the intersection of technology and the arts, and with more than 3 billion people playing games every day, creating exciting experiences at global scale has never been more essential. At AWS Game Tech, our mission is to help developers build amazing, successful, and fun games. To achieve this, we strive to help every game developer in the world leverage AWS to launch industry redefining experiences. Key job responsibilitiesWould you like to work with game developers, studios, and publishers and help them build the best games possible leveraging AWS Solutions? As Head of Game Production in the Cloud Solutions and Business Development at AWS, you will be responsible for defining the AWS Game Technology solution strategy specifically focused on remote workstations, cloud-based source and asset control, and continuous build pipelines, to support remote and hybrid development teams. Your responsibilities will include:1/ Leading our world-wide solution strategy and go-to-market plans for Game Production in the Cloud (GPIC) including decomposing GPIC into the specific customer outcome based use cases (i.e. Source & Asset control,CI/CD (Continuous Integration & Continuous Delivery) pipeline, remote workstations); 2/ Work with key stakeholder groups to prioritize solution development focus; 3/ Act as the ‘solution expert’ both internally and externally including leading the development of thought leadership content (Blogs, Webpage, and 3rd party events); and 4/ Engage with lighthouse customers to initiate POC’s that will ultimately move to a referenceable production workloads. In this role you will be instrumental in helping game creators invent the future of the games industry in ways that have yet to be imagined, driving critical components to AWS Game Tech’s go-to-market strategy World Wide.

TITLE: AWS Sr. Sales Manager, Enterprise MidSouth
QUALIFICATIONS: BASIC QUALIFICATIONS• 10+ years of technology related sales or business development experience.• 7+ years of sales management experience selling cloud solutions.• BA/BS degree required or equivalent experience.• Experience leading a team of sellers PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS• A technical or educational background in engineering, computer science, or MIS• Experience selling cloud solutions at a software company• Experience in a technology startup or experience working with startups, and an understanding of their buying behaviors.• MBA/MS degree in relevant field• Strong verbal and written communications skills• Strong leadership skills• Extensive customer network• Experience working with and presenting to C-level executives, IT, and lines of businesses across organizations• 7+ years of experience creating and implementing long-term transformational account strategies in a customer-facing role• Cross functional selling experience (Architect, Sales Engineer, Professional Services, Partner, and ISV)Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTION***This role can work from Washington DC Area, Charlotte, NC or Raleigh, NC***The AWS Sales team is responsible for serving the needs of medium to large enterprise customers. We take pride in leading customers through an accelerated and innovative cloud journey and creating long-term business relationships of value and trust.As part of the AWS Sales team, you will have the opportunity to work alongside a motivated team that values and encourages diversified perspectives and ideas to best equip customers with the most innovative and comprehensive solutions. Key job responsibilitiesAs a Senior Sales Leader you will have the opportunity to lead a sales team which focuses on adoption and expansion of our full service portfolio with our customers. We work backwards from our customers, focusing on their use cases and defining how our broad set of technology solutions can help them. Planning for market adoption, setting vision and strategy for your team, and pivoting on emerging market trends are all things you will do on a daily basis. You will help to identify with your team where our products need to go next to better serve our customers.You will help drive revenue, adoption, and market penetration in accounts. You will hire and develop high performance teams that are focused on customer obsession and working backwards to help customers achieve outcomes. You will also be responsible for building your go-to-market initiatives across functional teams, specialist, and partner teams to help scale our business.A day in the lifeOur team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.About the teamOur team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded executive and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
