TITLE: Sr. Manager LCC WWPS Partners, LCC
QUALIFICATIONS: 10+ years of general management and/or sales leadership experience for a relevant technology provider in the IT industry 7+ years of direct sales and/or partner management experience leading teams across public sector multiple markets. 5+ years of demonstrated experience with Public Sector verticals (Government, Education, Healthcare and Non-Profits) Ability to communicate fluently in English and Spanish (verbal and written). Effective oral, written and interpersonal communication skills. Ability to think strategically, innovatively and creatively using sound business judgment and quantitative skills. BA/BS required or equivalent experience This role requires domestic and international travel as permitted by foreign government travel restrictions (may be up to 50%) Knowledge of international government technology policy trends and priorities. Demonstrated experience in international Partner led sales and engagements Demonstrated experience managing, coaching, and developing partner sales teams. Experience leading, implementing and executing field programs and resources (including extended and remote teams) Highly self-motivated with an entrepreneurial spirit, a high tolerance for ambiguity and complexity and the ability to be efficient with limited resources Experience working with or selling to government, education or non-profit institutions. Understanding of Cloud computing technology (public and hybrid cloud platforms or as-a-Service models: SaaS, PaaS, IaaS) with demonstrated ability to apply new technologies, models, and frameworks to solve business problems. Strong analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insight in order to drive customer adoption, make appropriate recommendations to the business and guide strategy and execution MBA is highly valued as is a technical background with Computer Science Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon Web Services (AWS) is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for world class candidates to lead and manage the strategic partner community and expansion efforts covering the geographies of Latin America, Canada and the Caribbean. Amazon is where innovation, risks, and ideas are celebrated. We are builders. At Amazon Web Services (AWS) we are inventing the future of cloud computing with a team of builders who try new things and dream big dreams. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in the cloud used by hundreds of thousands of developers, governments and organizations around the world. It is still Day 1 for us, and we are looking for curious people to be part of our diverse teams of thinkers, testers, and doers. Come join us and work with the latest cloud computing technologies that enable our customers and partners to do more with technology and change the world.Are you interested in leading a team, and the go-to-market strategy, for Public Sector Partners across Latin America, Canada and the Caribbean? This role is focused on increasing adoption of Amazon Web Services (AWS) in the International Public Sector (PS) segments (government, education, non-profits and healthcare) with/through partners delivering cloud computing services and solutions. Do you have the partner and business development experience, sales leadership and the cloud technical knowledge necessary to help further establish AWS as the leading cloud platform provider? AWS LCC (Latin America, Canada & Caribbean) is seeking a leader for the Public Sector Partner business, (including Systems Integrators, ISVs, Resellers and Distributors). This leader will be responsible for the Public Sector Partner strategy and execution and developing/managing a regional and functional Partner Management teams. We are looking for a Sr. level Manager to join our team. As a Sr. Manager within Amazon Web Services (AWS) you will have the exciting opportunity to drive the partner growth plan and shape the future of emerging technology in the public sector (government, education, healthcare and non-profit verticals and with state owned entities). You will be responsible for delivering results of top line revenue growth and overall LCC PS market expansion with/through partners increasing solution creation and adoption. This role will work with our regional partner teams to develop strategies for expanding AWS consumption by Public Sector organizations. We help our partners define expansion priorities, develop and close opportunities aligning with partner, sales, architect and marketing teams. The ideal candidate will possess a strong management, leadership, sales/sales management and partner background across the international markets with experience building teams and partner strategy. Engaging across public sector to advance AWS business objectives in target markets. Successful Managers have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions. Ability to drive engagement and interact at the partner and AWS executive leadership levels.About UsInclusive Team CultureHere at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.]Work/Life BalanceOur team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.Mentorship & Career GrowthOur team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on tasks that are more complex in the future.Key job responsibilitiesServe as a key Leader of the AWS Public Sector Partner and LCC Management Team. Working collaboratively and transparently with AWS sales/partner leaders to ensure alignment on core business prioritiesManage and develop the LCC partner team members to exceed goals/KPIs and provide coaching on career developmentIncrease partner/customer satisfactionDrive revenue and market share selling to and with LCC PS partners. Maintaining an accurate and robust pipeline and forecast of business opportunities.Build/execute the strategic LCC sales & business development partner plan working with key internal and external stakeholders (e.g. sales, service, technical, legal, marketing, etc.) to define and execute high impact, joint sales and go-to-market programs focused on public sectorLead and manage strategic partner initiatives across a broad geography engaging with International and WWPS counterparts.Develop and execute against a repeatable model for expansion into new markets and establishing foundational partner sales activities.Understand the technical requirements of our partners/customers and work closely with the solutions architecture team to guide the direction of our product offerings. Ensuring that AWS is each partner’s preferred public cloud computing platform (across all partner product lines utilizing the AWS service portfolio)Prepare and deliver business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks to assigned targets, keeping executive leadership informed on progress against objectives.Engage the partner’s Sr. Leadership (marketing, channels and end customers) to create and drive revenue opportunities for AWS.Identify specific customer segments and industry verticals to approach with a joint value proposition for using AWS. Position AWS for internal use by the partner organization.Understand the legal, compliance, security, technical, contract vehicles/procurement considerations and certifications specific to public sector that impact PS partners

TITLE: Sr. Life Sciences Account Manager, Startups
QUALIFICATIONS: 5-10 years of technology related sales or business development experience in the Life Science industry BA/BS degree required MBA/MA/MS degree Previous cloud expertise at a technology company A technical background in engineering or computer science History of working for, or selling to tech startups Excellent verbal and written communication skills Comfortable delivering results amid ambiguity and change Passion for helping startups grow Entrepreneurial “builder” mentality
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon Web Services (AWS) offers a complete set of cloud services that enable all companies, from startups to enterprises, to run virtually everything in the cloud, including mobile applications, big data analytics, AI/ML platforms, and microservices/serverless infrastructures. Startups, which are now primarily born-in-the-cloud, represent a critically important and growing subset of customers to AWS. Funding for healthcare and life science (HCLS) startups has broken records since 2015, as 2 out of every 5 IPOs have been healthcare or life science companies. The healthcare and life science industries possess countless opportunities for innovation and disruption. These companies have unique needs, regulatory considerations, sales cycles, and growth trajectories that distinguish them from traditional companies. These businesses require different engagement strategies and sales motions from sellers to effectively acquire, grow, and retain them long-term on the AWS platform.As AWS continues to rapidly grow, we seek a US Life Sciences Startup Account Manager to earn trust and help drive the growth of high-potential early, mid, and late stage startups. Your responsibilities will include driving revenue, crafting partnerships, accelerating science, and ensuring new Life Sciences startups select AWS as their primary cloud provider. You will align closely with HCLS counterparts in business development, marketing, solution architecture and partner teams to lead execution of coordinated go-to-market strategies and sales plays. You will also work closely with business development teams who are driving strategic support, global co-programming, and portfolio engagement to help drive top-of-funnel customer acquisition and accelerate seller cycles in the field.You will be at the heart of the latest sub-industry trends like genomics, biopharma, drug discovery, and medical devices. Your customers will leverage state-of-the-art technologies on AWS to innovate and become the next global HCLS influencers like today’s Illumina, Novartis, Bristol-Myers Squibb, and Cerner. You need to possess passion about Life Sciences, a self-starter with a strong entrepreneurial spirit who is prepared to work in a fast-paced, often ambiguous environment, execute against ambitious goals, and consistently embrace the Amazon Culture.Key Responsibilities: Ensure customer success with early, mid and late stage startupsDrive revenue and market share in a defined territory or industry verticalAccelerate customer adoption through well-developed sales engagements and successful GTM StrategyMeet or exceed quarterly revenue and goal targets.Develop and execute against a comprehensive account/territory plan.Create & articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services.Accelerate customer adoption by engaging Founders, CxO, Board of Directors and VC influencersWork with partners to extend reach & drive adoption.Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts.Ensure customer satisfaction.Expect moderate travel.About the teamInclusive Team CultureHere at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.Work/Life BalanceOur team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.Mentorship & Career GrowthOur team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

TITLE: Global Supply Manager, Networking Commodities
QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s or an advanced degree in supply chain, business, engineering, finance or related technical or quantitative field, or additional 5+ Years work experience in supply chain or sourcing or procurement of hardware in lieu of a degree 4+ years of experience in supply/in-stock management, forecast/demand/supply/capacity planning, enterprise technology, or electronics manufacturing 2+ years of experience with data analysis tools such as Excel, Pivot Tables ,SQL, Python, Tableau, etc.. MBA or advanced degree in engineering or other quantitative disciplines 2+ years of experience in supply management of consumer electronics, electronic components, original design manufacture (ODM) of networking equipment, personal computers, or servers Broad supply chain experience, such as new product introduction, forecast/demand/supply/capacity planning, and supplier management Strong proficiency in analysis tools including Microsoft Excel, SQL, Tableau, and statistics software Excellent creative thinking skills with emphasis on developing innovative solutions to solve complex problems that may not have one clear answer Ability to think strategically and execute tactically with a bias for action Demonstrated ability to influence at the executive level internally and with suppliers High degree of business ethics and accountability Strong business and financial acumen Experience leading negotiations for complex, mission critical technology Strong communications (verbal and written) skills
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon Web Services (AWS) provides a highly reliable, scalable, and low-cost cloud platform that powers thousands of businesses in over 190 countries. AWS’ Infrastructure Supply Chain & Procurement (ISCaP) organization works to deliver cutting-edge solutions to source, build and maintain our socially responsible data center supply chains. We are a team of highly-motivated, engaged, and responsive professionals who enable the core sustainable infrastructure of AWS. Come join our team and be a part of history as we deliver results for the largest cloud services company on Earth!The ISCaP Networking team is looking for a results-oriented individual to own supply management of networking hardware. This individual will own the supply strategy and relationship with multiple suppliers and will interact with engineering to coordinate ramp and launch of new hardware platforms. Our Global Supply Managers are (or become) experts in their industries and help drive the explosive growth of AWS.General Work Activities: Create and execute supply planning strategies to meet the category, department, project and customer needsPrioritize activities and align with stakeholders to deliver supply globally with a high degree of predictabilityManage supplier relationships and allocation of material to demands based on priorityBe a subject matter expert for the customers, technologies, and markets in which you engageManage cross-functional projects against plans and objectives to meet commitments and goalsIdentify and drive realization of opportunities for durable, relative advantage in your categoryFunction Specific Work Activities: Analyze industry trends and evolving technology to proactively identify supply base opportunities to minimize risk, protect continuity of supply, and utilize industry developments that benefit AmazonIdentify and pursue opportunities to leverage and consolidate the supply base using system level tools and techniquesUnderstand forecasting, demand planning, material/supply/inventory planning, and manufacturing processes/capacity to verify supply commitmentsManage supply buffers and allocation to shorten lead times and build resiliency into the supply chain without driving excessDrive supplier improvement initiatives to continually lower risk and reduce lead timesInfluence suppliers' manufacturing processes, technology decisions, and policies in ways that are mutually beneficial and sustainable for both organizationsA day in the lifeYou will be working closely with multiple ODM suppliers to plan supply of critical hardware used across server, core and agg networking reack applications. You will partner with engineering to develop and launch new hardware platforms, drive second sourcing strategies and implement buffer plans. In this role you will be looking at "what's next" on the technology roadmap so you can build a supply strategy to support it.About the teamYou will join a team of highly capable and driven global supply managers who have experience from inside and outside the tech/networking industry. We are diving deeper into the supply chain and working closer with our ODM partners. Although we have a ways to go, we have a heavy focus on automation and tools creation. We encourage and empower our team members be "builders", just as much as we are supply managers. This is a great place to apply and grow your knowledge of technology, take ownership for your space, and grow into a future leader.

Our Global Supply Managers are (or become) experts in their industries and help drive the explosive growth of AWS.General Work Activities: Create and execute supply planning strategies to meet the category, department, project and customer needsPrioritize activities and align with stakeholders to deliver supply globally with a high degree of predictabilityManage supplier relationships and allocation of material to demands based on priorityBe a subject matter expert for the customers, technologies, and markets in which you engageManage cross-functional projects against plans and objectives to meet commitments and goalsIdentify and drive realization of opportunities for durable, relative advantage in your categoryFunction Specific Work Activities: Analyze industry trends and evolving technology to proactively identify supply base opportunities to minimize risk, protect continuity of supply, and utilize industry developments that benefit AmazonIdentify and pursue opportunities to leverage and consolidate the supply base using system level tools and techniquesUnderstand forecasting, demand planning, material/supply/inventory planning, and manufacturing processes/capacity to verify supply commitmentsManage supply buffers and allocation to shorten lead times and build resiliency into the supply chain without driving excessDrive supplier improvement initiatives to continually lower risk and reduce lead timesInfluence suppliers' manufacturing processes, technology decisions, and policies in ways that are mutually beneficial and sustainable for both organizationsA day in the lifeYou will be working closely with multiple Optics integrators to plan supply of critical hardware used across intra and inter data center applications. You will partner with engineering to develop and launch new optics platforms, drive second sourcing strategies, implement buffer plans, and manage inventory to target levels to drive optimal cost and supply supportability strategies. In this role you will be looking at "what's next" on the technology roadmap so you can build a supply strategy to support it.About the teamYou will join a team of highly capable and driven global supply managers who have experience from inside and outside the tech/networking industry. DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONJob summaryWe are looking for an experienced cross-functional director, which will lead a multi-disciplinary group that may include engineers, scientists, product managers, operations, etc. This leader will lead a group that works to prevent instances of fraud and abuse in Amazon’s world-wide online stores. This leader will build and launch scalable systems and services that use machine learning models to identify fraudulent or abusive behaviors. The leader will also support Amazon’s growing business needs through the systems and services they build which they will vend a service to other Amazon teams.Some of the projects this leader will work on may include experimenting with new machine learning techniques and methodologies to identify abnormal or risky patterns, launching new services that prevents fraudulent or abusive content from reaching Amazon’s customers, launching new services that reduce the reliance on human-decisioning in favor of machine-decisioning, launching new systems and processes that reduce the time it takes Amazon to launch new risk controls - empowering other Amazon businesses to react to changing trends in fraud and abuse attempts.We are looking for a director that can apply critical thinking and innovate in fast-paced environment, having their decisions directly influence Amazon’s world-wide customers. We are a diverse team that is passionate about operational excellence and high-quality deliverables. We value transparency, empowerment, experimentation, and appreciation. Our solutions influence the products and plans of multiple Amazon teams, and we design and build systems that directly influence the shopping experience of millions of customers.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon has built a reputation for excellence with recent examples of being named #1 in customer service, #1 most trusted, and #2 most innovative. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is carrying on that tradition while leading the world in Cloud technologies. As a member of the AWS Support team you will be at the forefront of this transformational technology assisting global financial services companies that are taking advantage of a growing set of services and features to run their mission-critical applications. You will work with leading companies in the financial services space and directly with the engineering teams within Amazon developing these new capabilities.The AWS Support team is seeking an Enterprise Support Manager that enjoys solving problems, working with customers, and who has a background from a variety of different fields. If you have experience leading teams responsible for building or managing full application stacks from the system (Linux or Windows) up through a custom application, managing part of a network from layer 3 and higher, or web-related programming that includes the consumption of web services we’d like to talk with you!You will be surrounded by people who are incredibly smart, passionate about cloud computing, and believe that world class support is critical to customer success. Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while your team:· Manages assigned Enterprise accounts and oversee support cases· Completes analysis and presents periodic reviews of operational performance to customer· Provides detailed reviews of service disruptions, metrics, detailed pre-launch planning· Makes recommendations on how new AWS offerings fit in the company architecture· Advocate for customer features and requirements within AWS (be their voice internally)· Participates in customers meetings (onsite or via phone)· Knows and uses all key customer resolution tools across all service groups to facilitate rapid resolution of customer concerns.· Works directly with Amazon Web Service engineers to ensure that customer issues are resolved as expediently as possible.This position requires that the candidate selected be a U.S. citizen. The position further requires that, after start, the selected candidate obtain and maintain an active TS/SCI security clearance with polygraph and satisfy other security related requirements. Upon application you will be asked qualifying questions that will be used only in relation to the US Government Security Clearance required for this role.*While this role is posted in Herndon, Virginia, this position can also be located in: Denver, CO; Seattle, WA.About the teamThe Americas Public Sector (AMER-PS) Enterprise Support team is comprised of Enterprise Account Engineers (EAEs) and Enterprise Support Managers (ESMs) who hail from various Public Sector backgrounds. We seek a diverse talent pool with different technical backgrounds, perspectives and experiences to shepherd our Enterprise Support customers through their cloud journey. Public Sector entities often operate differently than Commercial/private sector in the ways they procure, adopt, accredit, and deploy technology. Our emphasis on serving these customers and their specific needs allows tailoring the Enterprise Support product to best suit them.

TITLE: Project Kuiper Satellite Space, Senior Product Manager, Kuiper B2B Product Management
QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's degree Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product • Be comfortable with ambiguity and curious to learn new skills • Curious to learn in depth about both technology and our customers • A curious self-starter with a proven track record of diving into unknown territory, learning new concepts, and pushing your comfort zone. • An effective multi-tasker who navigates a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment with grace and efficiency. • Excellent at creating and maintaining working relationships across all levels and disciplines, receptive to feedback and input from others, and quick to apply changes.
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONHave you ever wanted to be part of a team who is building industry changing technology? Amazon’s Project Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low-latency, high-speed broadband network connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world.Are you looking to create value for millions of customers by helping to develop creative assets for Kuiper? Do you want to work at a company where you are the owner, where you are encouraged to build, and where you have the autonomy to push boundaries? Do you have a passion for design and a desire to bring delightful, cutting-edge products and services to life in an entirely new way? This describes your daily journey. Are you ready? Then join us on Project Kuiper.Do you get excited by aerospace, space exploration, and/or satellites? Do you want to help build solutions at Project Kuiper to transform the space industry? If so, then we would love to talk!Key job responsibilitiesEnterprise Services Senior Product Manager - Technical, will play a supporting role in defining and implementing customer-oriented services for Kuiper satellite communication services, globally. The successful candidate will have experience with satellite broadband and telecommunication services for Enterprise, Teleco, or Industrial verticals, and their differences across the globe.In this role, you will help define our services portfolio and features for Enterprise offerings. You will work with business development with customers, engineering teams, and operational stakeholders to help define Kuiper service and feature offerings via expertly crafted working backwards, business requirements documents which can easily be translated into product and engineering deliverables.You will work in a collaborative, analytical, and fast-paced environment and must be comfortable interacting with highly technical cross-functional teams. The candidate must have clear business judgment, dive deep into data, and have core writing skills.Candidates must be able to analyze and recommend subscription lifecycle models with appropriate KPIs for different customer segments. Candidates will have deep understanding of customer needs for modern telecommunication services. Candidates with demonstrated business and operational experience within high scale fixed, wireless and satellite telecommunications services targeting enterprise verticals will be preferred.Export Control Requirement:Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.A day in the life• Support defining the service offerings, pricing, SLAs, and customer experience for Enterprise services at a global level, to meet requirements of multiple customer verticals• Interpret spectrum resource costs and productize into a digestible services for B2B companies, with aligned services portfolio strategy• Create detailed product requirements documents including use case prioritization, feature definition and product roadmap• Support the product strategy and make appropriate judgment trade-offs between features and speed-to-launch• Manage the product life cycle and work with key internal and external stakeholdersAbout the teamHere at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. Amazon has ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious and earn trust. At Amazon, our mission is to be the most customer-centric company on Earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright and driven people.Work/Life BalanceOur team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.Mentorship & Career GrowthOur team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.Innovation is part of our DNA! Our goal is to be Earth's most customer-centric company, and we are just getting started. We need people who want to join an ambitious program that continues to push the state of the art in space-based systems design and wireless systems.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAWS is seeking a world class professional to develop our global customer relationships with a strategic company. The focus is on the top two divisions who focus on curating vast amounts of data and applying AI/ML to provide insights to advance the rule of law and identity solutions in insurance, financial services, government, and healthcare. As part of the Strategic Account Segment, the Account Manager will be responsible for creation, identification of new workloads in a highly competitive landscape. You will own and expand CXO relationships within the account, including engaging with AWS senior leadership team for executive sponsorships, coordinating executive business reviews, and maintaining customer satisfaction. ResponsibilitiesThe Account Manager is responsible for expanding beyond the customer’s IT Organization to build strategic relationships across the account, articulating a clear vision and generating enthusiasm, while impacting all business groups. You will be responsible for selling at the most strategic level within the account and implementing a broad strategy for earning customer acceptance and service implementation. You will work with all appropriate AWS resources (Executives, Solution Architects, Business Development, Marketing, Partners, Support, Service teams and Professional Services) to support customer interests. This includes dotted line responsibility for downstream and technical resources that may be geographically distributed. Development of formal case studies and other forms of references highlighting activity and workloads running on AWS is core to the role.Develop and execute a three year strategy. Primary locations in NYC, CO, CA, GA domestically and UK, Paris and Amsterdam. Travel required.Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud. We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional. Key job responsibilitiesManages accounts of significant size, depth, and complexity. Generally responsible for a select number of key accounts that generate a significant amount of revenue. Customers are typically complex in organizational structure and may operate across multiple geographies. Sales efforts will involve aligning multiple stakeholders and lines of business in an account and require complex decision making process that includes multiple executives across both the customer and AWS. May require influencing and orchestrating sales activities and teams across multiple geographies.Participates and leads with a high degree of proficiency in the negotiation of legalagreements and contract terms with external parties. Negotiates critical relationships and agreements with customers, suppliers or other external partners at the higher levels.Works on significant and unique issues where current best practices may not exist in the market. DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONDo you excel in high-complexity engagements and want to innovate on behalf of the customer within one of the largest e-commerce companies in the world who processes billions of secure on-line transactions via a number of payment mechanisms? Amazon is seeking a talented, highly motivated and experienced individual to join the Payment Acceptance & Experience organization, which is responsible for enabling customers globally to pay for services with their preferred payment methods. As part of the Strategic Payments Partnership team the Sr. Partner Manager manages the strategic engagement between Amazon and the global payment partner at the executive level and drives the execution of those strategies through teams at both the partner and Amazon. The role will entail concurrently driving multiple global initiatives that may involve commercial, marketing, product, and technology components across a broad spectrum of businesses and geographies; including negotiation for unconventional deals which have broad implications across multiple Amazon business units. It is crucial for the candidate to be forward-thinking and capable of illustrating the benefits of new payments innovations with our partners. This key role will be highly visible at the most senior levels of Amazon. You will need to work collaboratively with internal management teams to understand our relative advantages and risks, know when major features are in existing roadmaps, and current payment industry trends around innovation, consolidation and customer adoption. The ideal candidate will possess a strong business development and a background in credit and debit cards, payments, financial services, with significant experience in e-commerce. The candidate should have demonstrated experience engaging senior-level executives in past roles, and a credible understanding of the overall payment ecosystem. You will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the skill-set to drive tactical execution of business development goals. Specific responsibilities include the following: · Create strategic business development plans and ensure these plans are in line with the overall Amazon Consumer Payments strategy · Execute the strategic business development plans while working closely with internal stakeholders including finance, product & technology, legal, operations and customer service teams · Evaluate the economic and strategic cost-benefit of new opportunities · Support the strategic objectives and interests of Amazon’s business teams on a global basis

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONHelp us develop the algorithms and models that power computer vision services at Amazon, such as Amazon Rekognition, Amazon Go, Visual Search, and more! We are combining computer vision, mobile robots, advanced end-of-arm tooling and high-degree of freedom movement to solve real-world problems at huge scale. As an intern, you will help build solutions where visual input helps the customers shop, anticipate technological advances, work with leading edge technology, focus on highly targeted customer use-cases, and launch products that solve problems for Amazon customers. A successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, strong attention to detail, and the ability to work in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. You will own the design and development of end-to-end systems and have the opportunity to write technical white papers, create technical roadmaps, and drive production level projects that will support Amazon Science. You will work closely with Amazon scientists, and other science interns to develop solutions and deploy them into production. The ideal scientist must have the ability to work with diverse groups of people and cross-functional teams to solve complex business problems.Amazon Science gives insight into the company’s approach to customer-obsessed scientific innovation. Amazon fundamentally believes that scientific innovation is essential to being the most customer-centric company in the world. It’s the company’s ability to have an impact at scale that allows us to attract some of the brightest minds in artificial intelligence and related fields. Amazon Scientist use our working backwards method to enrich the way we live and work. For more information on the Amazon Science community please visit https://www.amazon.science

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONProject Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low-latency, high-speed broadband connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world. The mission of Project Kuiper’s Government Solutions (KGS) is to leverage Kuiper and provide high speed, low latency, and secure satellite broadband services to United States and allied government customers.We have an immediate opening for a Sr. Technical Program Manager to support the Kuiper Government Solutions (KGS) team focusing on U.S. Government customers such as NASA, DoD, and National Security. As a Sr. Technical Program Manager, you will work with technical and senior leadership across the program to ensure Kuiper government systems meet the highest engineering standards. In addition to building and maintaining processes of the Kuiper Government Solutions team, you will be responsible for establishing and tracking milestones and project priorities to maximize development efficiency, identify project critical paths, and ensure supplier/partner products are delivered on time and to Kuiper specifications. You will work in a collaborative, analytical, and fast-paced environment and must be comfortable interacting with highly technical cross-functional teams. The candidate must have strong business judgment, dive deep into data, have strong writing skills, and be comfortable leading executive-level reviews.The best candidates will have deep understanding of aerospace/satellite and systems engineering, as well as DoD/IC cyber and security standards, practices and assessments. Candidates with demonstrated experience in deployed secure satellite telecommunications services will be preferred. This position will be based in in the Northern Virginia area.Key job responsibilitiesThis role is responsible for defining Project Kuiper’s government communication systems provisioning, management, and monitoring solutions in support of a wide variety of government customer ground, air, maritime, and space based users utilizing Kuiper’s Low Earth Orbit satellites. This is a unique opportunity to assist in the development of a global broadband communication system. You will work closely with the commercial satellite and consumer terminal teams to organize resources, schedule milestones, and track achievements in the group. In addition, you will be responsible for identifying project dependencies and critical paths in government systems development. On a day-to-day basis, you will coordinate among teams and subcontractors to surface and solve the critical risks to the programs you are assigned to lead. In this role you will: • Devise and implement plans for NIST 800-53 compliance assessments and improvements• Specify and implement service provisioning, management, monitoring, and operations solutions in support of various government customers, each with unique security and cyber concerns. Oversee and monitor implementation, testing, and fielding of those solutions.• Propose and drive adoption of improvements to the Kuiper program to improve government user utility and satisfaction• Act as the point of contact for Kuiper Government Solutions with external teams, partners, and subcontractors for assigned solutions, to identify and mitigate programmatic risks in order to meet established goals • Communicate clearly and effectively to executive management on the plans, status, and critical issues in narrative and verbal formats. Escalate urgent issues appropriately and drive them to closure in a timely manner • Document trade studies for intra-team review for stakeholder buy-in • Establish and perform subcontract management and define and assess vendor deliveries• Organize regular project and team meetings, focusing design teams on program milestones and unblock technical issues by pulling together the multi-functional technical expertise to resolve issues • Set agenda, communicate meeting notes and actions, follow up with responsible owners • Develop, track, & communicate project schedules and achievements • Drive project execution, develop project plans, make technical trade-offs, manage risks, track and report on status, and resolve blocking issues• Work closely with partner organizations (including government agencies) to develop work packages and ensure that all teams have what they need to be successful• Establish goals and metrics to identify opportunities to deliver customer solutions to meet cost, performance and schedule requirements.This position is in Arlington, VA. Some travel, primarily domestic, will be required.Security Clearance: Candidates must have recent or active US Government security clearance of TS/SCI (with polygraph preferred) and be able to maintain a TS/SCI security clearance, so you must be a U.S. citizen for consideration.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONHave you ever wanted to be part of a team who is building industry changing technology? Amazon’s Project Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low-latency, high-speed broadband network connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world.Are you looking to create value for millions of customers by helping to develop creative assets for Kuiper? Do you want to work at a company where you are the owner, where you are encouraged to build, and where you have the autonomy to push boundaries? Do you have a passion for design and a desire to bring delightful, cutting-edge products and services to life in an entirely new way? This describes your daily journey. Are you ready? Then join us on Project Kuiper.Do you get excited by aerospace, space exploration, and/or satellites? Do you want to help build solutions at Project Kuiper to transform the space industry? If so, then we would love to talk!Key job responsibilitiesTelco / Backhaul Principle Product Manager - Technical, will play a pivotal role in defining and implementing customer-oriented services for Kuiper satellite communication services, globally. The successful candidate will have deep understanding of satellite broadband and telecommunication services for Telco / Backhaul verticals, and their differences across the globe.In this role, you will define and be responsible for success of our services portfolio for Telco / Backhaul offerings. You will work directly with customers, engineering teams, and operational stakeholders to define Kuiper service offerings via expertly crafted working backwards, business requirements documents which can easily be translated into product and engineering deliverables.You will work in a collaborative, analytical, and fast-paced environment and must be comfortable interacting with highly technical cross-functional teams. The candidate must have clear business judgment, dive deep into data, have core writing skills and be comfortable leading executive-level reviews.Candidates must be able to analyze and implement subscription lifecycle models with appropriate KPIs for different customer segments. Candidates will have deep understanding of customer needs for modern telecommunication services. Candidates with demonstrated business and operational experience within high scale fixed, wireless and satellite telecommunications services targeting Telco / Backhaul verticals will be preferred.Export Control Requirement:Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.#approvedforexternalA day in the life• Define the service offerings, pricing, SLAs, and customer experience for Telco / Backhaul services at a global level, to meet requirements of multiple customer verticals• Interpret spectrum resource costs and productize into a digestible services for B2B companies, with aligned services portfolio strategy• Create detailed product requirements documents based on an intimate knowledge of the specific customer verticals including use case prioritization, feature definition and product roadmap• Set the customer product strategy and make appropriate high-judgment trade-offs between features and speed-to-launch• Manage overall the product life cycle and work with key internal and external stakeholdersAbout the teamHere at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. Amazon has ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious and earn trust. At Amazon, our mission is to be the most customer-centric company on Earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright and driven people.Work/Life BalanceOur team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.Mentorship & Career GrowthOur team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.Innovation is part of our DNA! Our goal is to be Earth's most customer-centric company, and we are just getting started. We need people who want to join an ambitious program that continues to push the state of the art in space-based systems design and wireless systems.We're dedicated to supporting new team members. Our team has a broad mix of experience levels and Amazon tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

TITLE: Startup SA Manager, AI/ML
QUALIFICATIONS: Experience leading and growing teams of senior technology professionals, ideally in customer facing roles Experience in leveraging AI/ML to solve business challenges Experience with modern AI/ML tools and frameworks High level of comfort communicating effectively across internal and external organizations, with both technical and non-technical audiences. Demonstrated ability to match technical solutions to real business problems Experience in designing, building and operating large scale IT solutions Good knowledge of software development tools and methodologies Experience presenting to executives, IT Management, and developers Demonstrated effectiveness working across multiple business units to achieve results Experience communicating effectively across internal and external organizations Technical degree, or equivalent career experience Experience using and adapting to new technologies Experience with technical consulting and/or architecture engagements with startup companies Experience migrating or transforming customer solutions to the cloud Hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services, including one or more AWS Certifications
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONDo you have a passion for Startups? Do you have a passion for helping key startup companies grow and thrive? Do you have a passion for leveraging Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning to help solve hard problems? Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for an experienced and motivated technical manager to coach, grow, and partner with skilled Startups Solutions Architects focusing on a wide range of customers. Working in collaboration with our sales teams, you will drive growth across a set of customers in this segment with a focus on AI/ML.Key job responsibilitiesIn this role, you will need to be technically capable and credible in your own right as well as effective in shaping the customer-facing and technical skills of your team. In addition to technical knowledge and leadership experience it is important to have a solid understanding of the Startup journey. We are looking for technical builders who love the idea of working with early-stage startups to help them as they grow. In this role, you’ll work directly with a variety of interesting customers and help them make the best (and sometimes the most pragmatic) technical decisions along the way. You’ll have a chance to build enduring relationships with these companies and establish yourself as a trusted advisor. You will also have a solid understanding of the unique challenges startups face and how technology can empower their businesses.You will help team members ramp up on AWS and develop speaking, writing, presentation, and executive interaction skills. You will need to be adept at interacting, communicating, and partnering with other departments within AWS such as our Services Teams, Marketing, Business Development, and the broader Solutions Architecture Organization, as well as representing your team to executive management.A day in the lifeAs a key member of the Startups Solutions Architecture leadership team, ensure our customers’ success in building and migrating infrastructure, software and services onto the AWS platform leveraging best practices and modern architecturesIn partnership with the sales and business development teams, formulate and execute a strategy to drive successful customer outcomes worldwide for startupsHire, on-board, train, and develop new Solutions ArchitectsCoach Solutions Architects in the skills needed to conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions so they can transfer deep technical skills to customers who are considering or using AWSCapture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the AWS Solutions Architect communityCreate and motivate the development of whitepapers, data sheets, solutions, quickstarts, and other high-value customer facing content and best practicesAct as a conduit and liaison between customers, service engineering teams and supportBroadly engage with Amazon leadership to communicate, drive your vision, and work across the organizationOpen to domestic travel up to 30%About the teamThe AWS Startups team partners with startups around the world to build, launch, grow, and help scale their business. We don’t just support startups with cloud infrastructure, but also partner with our startup customers throughout their journey by providing resources to tackle challenges from early stage fundraising to building technical teams and developing startup culture.As part of the AWS Startups team, you will have the unique opportunity to help shape the overall strategy and direction for broadening the use of Amazon’s cloud computing platform for startups within arguably the Earth’s most customer-centric company.

TITLE: Network Development Engineer III, ADC Networking
QUALIFICATIONS: This position requires that the candidate selected be a US citizen and obtain and maintain an active TS/SCI security clearance with polygraph. Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline or equivalent experience in a large–scale network environment 7+ years experience in a network focused hands-on technical role working with IP routing protocols/technologies and platforms in large scale data center and/or WAN network environments. 5+ years experience in a technical on-call capacity, responding to customer impacting events, mitigating and root cause analysis of those events. 7+ years Unix/Linux command line experience Experience with network operating systems such as Cisco IOS and Junos. Thorough understanding of TCP/IP networking, IP routing, Server Load Balancing, and Network Security architecture and core technologies such as IP, TCP, OSPF/IS-IS, BGP, MPLS, Server Load Balancers, Firewalls, ACLs, DNS, DHCP, IPAM, LDAP, NFS, etc. Knowledge of network analysis fundamentals and robust troubleshooting skills; specifically, network performance analysis Experience working with customers to diagnose a problem, and work toward resolution Strong desire to build, ability to multitask, sense of ownership and urgency. Strong Unix/Linux skills and ability to script in Perl, Python, shell, C or C++ is highly desirable as is a strong understanding of load balancing and layer 4-7 technologies Excellent verbal and written communication skills
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon’s network is a key differentiator for Amazon Web Services (AWS), enabling the global operation of services and applications across millions of network devices and servers worldwide. The AWS Networking team develops and operates the network platform for all of AWS, including US Public Sector facing cloud computing solutions. This platform is industry-leading for its efficiency, throughput and reliability, and it is critical to the success of 1+ Million AWS customers, including the US Government.As part of the Amazon Dedicated Cloud (ADC) Network Operations and Engineer team, you’ll play a key role in driving the stability, sustainability, and new designs of next-generation IP networks that support the U.S. Intelligence Community. From the top of rack to the network core and everything in between, you’ll work with best-in-class Network Engineers to deliver simple, sustainable and repeatable solutions and processes and drive complex issues to resolution. Using your experience with network and Unix systems engineering, you’ll be able to fully own and transform networking projects relating to deployment, implementation, scaling, and/or optimization.As a Network Development Engineer, you’ll partner with our broader Infrastructure organization on configuration standards and tools, and collaborate with Systems and Software Engineers to ensure fast, smooth roll-out of new designs and products, and also deploy and sustain networking software tools.Special RequirementsThis position requires that the candidate selected be a U.S. citizen, must currently possess and maintain an active TS/SCI security clearance with polygraph.Inclusive Team Culture Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.Work/Life Balance We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud. Mentorship and Career growthWe’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

Experience and success in negotiating complex deals with customers and partners.
