DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONMULTIPLE POSITIONS AVAILABLECompany: AMAZON.COM SERVICES LLCPosition Title: Business Analyst IILocation: Seattle, WashingtonPosition Responsibilities:Support senior management by managing metrics reporting and performing data mining and big data analysis to provide strategic advice on business forecast models. Collect business use cases, research and evaluate opportunities to help Amazon leverage its data to support business functions through complicated mathematical modeling. Analyze forecast and metrics data. Automate reports for promotional and project launch campaigns. Utilize database technologies, including SQL, ETL, and Oracle to design, develop, and evaluate highly innovative business intelligence tools and automated reports for campaign targeting and optimization. Transform complicated business problems into mathematics modeling and provide data-driven solutions. Perform statistical analysis, including clustering, cross-session and panel data regression using R, SAS, STATA, and SPSS. Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, model validation, and model implementation.40 hours / week, 8:00am-5:00pm, Salary Range $90,438/year to $130,100/year Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation. Standard company benefits available. #0000

TITLE: Senior Systems Development Engineer, Enterprise Engineering, Project Kuiper
QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s Degree in Systems Engineering, Computer Science or related field, or relevant work experience. 6+ years of experience in Systems and Network Administration, DevOps or Site Reliability Engineering. 6+ years of experience with focus in areas such as systems, network, and/or application security. 6+ years of experience with web protocols and Linux/Unix tools and architecture. 6+ year experience building scripts, tooling, and automation for large-scale computing environments using Python, Java, PHP, Ruby, or Bash/Shell. 6+ years of experience with agile software development practices. 8+ years of experience in Systems and Network Administration, DevOps or Site Reliability Engineering. Experience running and maintaining a 24x7 Internet-oriented production environment, preferably across multiple data centers, involving (preferably) at least hundreds of machines. Demonstrable expertise around specifying, designing, and/or implementing system health, performance monitoring tools, and software management tools for 24x7 environments. Familiar with the challenges surrounding efficient operations and failure mode analysis in large complex systems. Experience with configuration management systems such as cfengine, Chef, or PuppetExperience with open-source technologies. Understanding of design for scalability, performance and reliability. Automation, testing or monitoring framework development experience
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONProject Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low-latency, high-speed broadband connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world.In Project Kuiper Enterprise Engineering, we build the software, services, and infrastructure that enable our program to design and engineer the future of LEO Satellite based broadband services. We are an AWS-focused, builder-centric organization. We build with AWS technology to develop the best solution for our team to succeed. Our team succeeds when the entire Project Kuiper organization can scale as needed to be successful.Key job responsibilitiesProvision and manage AWS infrastructure, including EC2, CloudFormation Templates, AppStream, and Load Balancers.Build dash boarding and alarming to drive operational excellence.Work with a wide range of technologies, and AWS products.Build AWS Application Environments including VPC, EC2, RDS, SSM, S3.Architect and setup infrastructure on AWS and AWS gov-cloud environments.Analyze and Support setup of new devices connectivity to applications.Monitor network connectivity between all internal and external systems.Work closely with Application leads to understand needs and plan for infrastructure demands.Drive automation of routine tasks to help scale the operations.Maintain hardware architecture documentation for all infrastructure and networking components.Export Control Requirement: Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.About the teamAmazon’s Project Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low-latency, high-speed broadband network connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world.

TITLE: Software Development Manager - Nitro SSD
QUALIFICATIONS: 3+ years of engineering team management experience 7+ years of working directly within engineering teams experience 3+ years of designing or architecting (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience Experience partnering with product or program management teams Hands-on experience developing or managing developing teams doing Flash Translation Layer for SSD applications Hands-on experience with building and operating SSD based storage systems Knowledge and operational experience with storage, networking, and/or large-scale distributed systems. Hands on experience with one or more of the following protocol stacks including block storage (NVMe, SAS/SATA), networking (Ethernet, TCP/IP) and interface (PCIe, I2C). Excellent written communication and verbal skills Hands-on experience with Agile and Scrum software development methodologies and Program management An understanding of AWS technologies (aws.amazon.com).
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONWe are looking for an experienced Software Development Manager to build and operate next generation storage solutions for AWS world scale compute and storage solutions. This is the fastest growing storage platform for EC2 and EBS. The ideal candidate for this role will be an innovative, hands-on leader seasoned in embedded software development with experience in the Flash Translation Layer (FTL) architecture, development and operation at scale for SSDs. Prior experience with operating a large-scale service and leading software teams to raise the bar for performance and availability of the platform is a plus for the role. As a manager in this team, you will be leading a team of highly motivated software developers that thrive on solving challenging problems with innovative solutions. The team couples software and firmware skillsets with storage and scalable software engineering disciplines to deliver real world data center storage solutions. You would lead a team building, validating, and operating software solutions in diverse technology domains from embedded software platforms to large-scale distributed software systems in Python, C, and other languages using proprietary and open source technologies and Amazon services alike. You are highly organized, data-driven, have a passion for recruiting, leading and developing world-class engineering talent, and executing projects on aggressive timelines. You will collaborate with internal and external development teams (architecture, hardware, validation, software services). You will establish strategic vision and drive tactical execution in defining and delivering new storage solutions including qualification, validation and operational excellence. AWS Engineers are shaping the way people use computers and designing the future of cloud computing technology – come help us make history! What you will do: You will build and lead a team designing and building transformative AWS-specific firmware and software for non-volatile memory based storage solutions. You will deliver scalable storage solutions, with specific focus on FTL development, and associated operational infrastructure to automate monitoring and analysis services. Your team will lead the product qualification, launch, operational monitoring and sustaining of these platforms. You will work closely with other AWS software teams to tailor and operate storage solutions for the AWS environment. Why it matters: Public cloud IT services represent the majority of growth in the overall IT services market and will continue to do so for several years to come. The breathtaking scale of AWS, combined with a deep understanding of how our hardware is used, creates a unique opportunity for component customizations that will directly benefit our customers. Why you will love it: You will lead a team of engineers working with teams across the company to build and operate next-generation cutting edge infrastructure. You will have a direct impact on our bottom line and the ability to deliver features and functionality to our customers. You will be part of a growing, fast paced, and fun team and have ownership for the implementation of your work at AWS scale.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONThe mission of the Small business co-brand credit card team is to deliver exceptional value to Amazon's small business customers every time they use their card on or off-Amazon. We build features, models and experiences that delight prospects and existing customers through savings, perks and benefits; executing at scale and with automation. To do this, we personalize for individual customers and customer journeys, and in bringing these components together, we optimize for the overall customer experience. The successful candidate thrives in working at that intersection, and will be insatiably inquisitive about our customer experience and connect that experience with cutting-edge technical solutions to address customer-facing problems. We are looking for a Principal Product Manager to drive program growth and customer loyalty, while providing partners with a significant opportunity from collaborating with one of the largest and fastest growing retail businesses in the world. Key job responsibilitiesYou will be a strategic leader for the organization, working closely with engineering, UX design and research, data science, applied science, program management, legal, and marketing to deliver and enhance the customer experience. You will responsible for:• Defining the product vision, animating that product vision for stakeholders, and bringing the vision to life• Influencing multiple cross-functional teams working closely across teams • Being a subject matter expert on credit card economics and use that expertise to influence the value proposition for Customers• Constructing mechanisms to ensure customer feedback is understood and incorporated • Owning the long-term roadmap, corresponding execution and building a prioritization framework at scale• Being a learner. Building and sharing expertise in your subject matter areas through interactions across the Payments organization

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAWS established a specialized group of service teams responsible for the work we are doing with the U.S. Intelligence Community. We are building some of the largest and most complex distributed systems in the world, and we need adaptable people to help us implement and operate them. The AWS Intelligence team is seeking highly motivated engineers who are focused on operational excellence and troubleshooting complex system operations, have a good understanding of Linux, networking and general knowledge of cloud services. We need engineers who understand how to think big, and simplify solutions to complex problems; all the while ensuring that our customers continue to have the best experience possible. On a "typical" day, our engineers may dive deep to find the root cause of a customer issue, investigate why a metric is trending in the wrong direction, or discuss radical new approaches to automate operational processes. As a member of our team you will join a dedicated group of engineers who provide troubleshooting and operations support, and innovate to automate operational tasks.You will be able to take a defined project, break down the work to help define milestones, and feedback mechanisms. You identify when implementations are not highly available or have defects; you investigate systemic patterns. You resolve, mitigate, or escalate operational concerns in a timely mannerThis is a shift work position. This position requires that the candidate selected be a US Citizen and must currently possess a current, active US Government security clearance of TS/SCI with Polygraph. About the teamAbout UsInclusive Team CultureHere at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.Work/Life BalanceOur team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.Mentorship & Career GrowthOur team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

TITLE: AWS Sr. Sales Leader

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTION***This role can be based in Seattle, Los Angeles, San Francisco or Denver***AWS Senior Sales Leader As AWS continues to rapidly grow, we seek a Sr. Sales Leader to own driving adoption of Amazon Web Services within our Enterprise segment. In this role, you will accelerate adoption, building strategy through execution and inspirational leadership. This individual will build a business focused on helping enterprise customers innovate and exceed revenue goals. This leader must have the business savvy and sales leadership background necessary to bring together a cross functional team including sales, partner and product teams to deliver accelerated business growth for AWS and our customers. You will establish and maintain high-level relationships within key accounts, driving innovation and next-gen capabilities across infrastructure and business application landscapes. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a fast growing and entrepreneurial organization, bringing innovation and growing the adoption of cloud. This role will require you to scale a highly complex environment through strategic initiatives. As the Senior Leader focused on our most important Enterprise customers and partners in the West, you will have the exciting opportunity to help drive the growth and shape the future of cloud computing, by building and leading a sales team dedicated to helping our customers build and deliver innovative solutions leveraging the latest in AWS services. You will be responsible for developing opportunity pipelines, evangelizing cloud computing, and driving revenue and user adoption. You will also be responsible for building the AWS go-to-market through both your dedicated team and the cross-functional ecosystem. Work/Life Balance Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. TITLE: Senior Product Manager - Tech, Amazon Music, Cost Savings
QUALIFICATIONS: 2+ years of end to end product delivery experience 5+ years of technical product or program management experience Bachelor's degree Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition Track record of achievements. You’ve shipped cool stuff that has moved the needle on key business & customer metrics. You have demonstrated success building buy-in for an innovative and bold vision. Data-centric and analytical. You have experience using data and metrics to back up assumptions and assertions of business value. You also leverage your analytical skills and ability to dive deep to develop a nuanced understanding of your product and customers, and to create effective strategies. You also have a demonstrated ability to make high quality/high impact decisions in the absence of data and figure out how to gather data (through experiments, tests, etc) to support your decisions. Technical fluency. You have the ability to understand, discuss, and challenge architectural concepts, tradeoffs, and new opportunities with technical team members. Experience leading cross-functional teams to deliver products Experience effectively influencing senior leaders (VP, SVP, C-level) Thinks strategically, but stays on top of tactical execution MBA or master’s degree A passion for music!
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONLove music? Want to build consumer-facing products that touches the lives of millions of people? Combine your passions and come reinvent music listening with us! We’re working hard, having fun, and making history here at Amazon Music.We are seeking a creative and data-driven Product Manager who wants to partake in our journey towards profitability. In this role you will be responsible for experimenting with new ideas to reduce our operational costs, while preserving our customer and partner experience. You will be working closely with UX Design, Software Development, Finance, Marketing, and BI to drive this program with the right balance of external vs. internal customer obsession in mind. If you enjoy breadth of a role and frequent gratification on contributing millions $ towards our business' bottom line, then this role might be for you!About Amazon MusicAmazon Music reimagines music listening by enabling customers to unlock millions of songs and thousands of curated playlists and stations with their voice. Amazon Music provides unlimited access to new releases and classic hits across iOS and Android mobile devices, PC, Mac, Echo, and Alexa-enabled devices including Fire TV and more. With Amazon Music, Prime members have access to ad-free listening of 2 million songs at no additional cost to their membership. Listeners can also enjoy the premium subscription service, Amazon Music Unlimited, which provides access to more than 100 million songs and the latest new releases. Amazon Music Unlimited customers also now have access to the highest-quality listening experience available, with more than 100 million songs available in High Definition (HD), more than 7 million songs in Ultra HD, and a growing catalog of spatial audio. Customers also have free access to an ad-supported selection of top playlists and stations on Amazon Music. All Amazon Music tiers now offer a wide selection of podcasts at no additional cost, and live streaming in partnership with Twitch. Engaging with music and culture has never been more natural, simple, and fun. For more information, visit amazonmusic.com or download the Amazon Music app.Key job responsibilitiesIn this role, you will identify opportunities and build customer-facing products that decrease our operational costs while preserving the customer experience. You will set the product vision for the team, collaborate with internal stakeholders across marketing, UX, finance, legal, data science and guide an engineering teams towards that vision. You will also be expected to elevate the quality of data instrumentation across the existing suite of both customer-facing and technical (APIs) products and are expected to instill a culture of making customer-centric decisions through data and insights. You will also be a mentor to the other product managers on the team. This is a technical product manager position that requires ability to work across organizations, know-how in driving a large-scale project from inception to launch, willingness to deal with ambiguity and competing priorities. An ideal candidate is data-driven, results oriented and has a note-worthy track record in building consumer products.

TITLE: Principal Content Strategy Manager, Prime Video Licensing
QUALIFICATIONS: 4-year degree in a relevant field 6+ years of experience in investment banking, management consulting, or strategy/business development at a major media or technology company Experience using complex modeling and analysis to inform key business decisions. Candidates must be highly proficient in excel Excellent communication skills (both written and oral) Excellent analytical capabilities Strong work ethic and ability to work effectively with a high degree of autonomy
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAre you interested in shaping the future of movies and television? Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching? Prime Video is one of the leading digital video services on the Internet today, and we're just getting started changing the way millions of people enjoy content. Now available in more than 240 countries and territories, Prime Video offers customers the broadest selection of any on-demand video service, including our critically-acclaimed Amazon Originals such as the Emmy Award-winning comedies Fleabag and The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, Tom Clancy’s Jack Ryan, The Boys, The Lord of the Rings: Rings of Power, Jennifer Lopez action/comedy Shotgun Wedding, the Academy Award-winning Manchester by the Sea, Academy Award-nominated The Big Sick, exclusives, and live concerts and sports.Amazon Studios is the movies and television development and production arm of Amazon. It is our role to produce original content and license studio programs worldwide in exclusive service of Amazon’s Prime Video customers. We need your passion, innovative ideas, and creativity to help take us to new heights.The WW Licensing and Distribution team is seeking a Principal Content Strategy Manager to join our Los Angeles-based group. This team is responsible for licensing Prime Video’s 3rd party content, as well as monetizing our MGM library with 3rd parties. The WW Licensing and Distribution team works closely with senior leaders across creative development, content acquisition, finance, business affairs, marketing and production, and has a high degree of visibility within the organization. The Principal Manager role will be an essential member of the team, with broad analytical and strategic responsibilities.Key job responsibilities• Identify deep, actionable insights into the content preferences, behavior and needs of our customers, globally• Perform extensive competitive analysis and benchmarking, and identify and report on market trends• Forecast and monitor content performance, track progress, and understand sources of variance• Author business-driving documents that surface key learnings and provide recommendations for our go-forward content offering• Develop content acquisition plans, financial metrics, and goals for senior management• Lead all aspects of content licensing negotiations, including content selection, financial analysis, forecasting, and technical requirements• Use data on customer behavior, usage and consumption to inform decision-making• Collaborate with internal teams across all functional areas within Prime Video to define content strategies and to execute content licensing agreements (e.g., legal, finance, marketing, etc.)

TITLE: Senior Export Control PM, Project Kuiper SPACE
QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience 5+ years of experience developing export compliance and trade control programs 5+ years experience in the ITAR and EAR 5+ years experience delivering business critical projects that are global in nature, and using influence to drive adoption and compliance across engineering and business teams 5+ strategic leadership and management experience Experience with export controls applicable to sensitive and high-technology products and industries, such as aerospace, microelectronic circuits, telecommunications and encryption Trade compliance experience in both R&D and production environments Ability to demonstrate sound judgment even in ambiguous situations Ability to turn complex compliance requirements into scalable processes
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONProject Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low-latency, high-speed broadband connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world.Have you ever wanted to be part of a team who is building industry changing technology? Amazon’s Project Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low-latency, high-speed broadband network connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world.Are you looking to create value for millions of customers by helping to develop creative assets for Kuiper? Do you want to work at a company where you are the owner, where you are encouraged to build, and where you have the autonomy to push boundaries? Do you have a passion for design and a desire to bring delightful, cutting-edge products and services to life in an entirely new way? This describes your daily journey. Are you ready? Then join us on Project Kuiper.Do you get excited by aerospace, space exploration, and/or satellites? Do you want to help build solutions at Project Kuiper to transform the space industry? If so, then we would love to talk! Key job responsibilitiesWork with Legal and Global Trade & Compliance teams to drive strategy, drive and enforce global export control processesDrive transactional compliance with export regulations globally, including obtaining and monitoring the use of export authorizationsProvide export classification subject matter expertise, maintain jurisdiction and classification determinations, and develop strategic export classification processesSeek automation opportunities and leverage technologies to proactively detect and mitigate export compliance issuesDrive scalable business solutions with Kuiper stakeholders, including Engineering, Manufacturing, Procurement, Supply Chain, Logistics, Tax and other business teams to ensure compliance with export regulations globallyMaintain deemed export processes and procedures for Project Kuiper customers, vendors, employees, and visitorsDevelop and conduct new hire and ongoing export compliance training at all levels throughout the businessMonitor regulatory changes related to export controlsDevelop and conduct audits to verify compliance and the effectiveness of systems and processesExport Control Requirement:Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.A day in the lifeProject Kuiper is looking for an Export Control Manager to define program and product requirements to build, maintain and operate the technology, processes and controls which ensure Project Kuiper’s compliance with export control regulations globally. This role will encompass a broad range of regulatory compliance subjects, including: export compliance processes, software and technology exports, deemed exports, export licensing, export classification and all related export compliance governance requirements related to the business objectives of Project Kuiper. You will interact with Legal, Global Trade Services, HR, Tax, Engineering, Operations, Procurement, Supply Chain, and other internal businesses and external stakeholders to drive global export compliance. This position requires significant experience in export controls and demonstrated use of mechanisms to deliver training, and to enable and monitor compliance of business, engineering and operations stakeholders. The candidate should be an innovative compliance professional experienced in building cutting edge programs. In this role, the candidate will drive and scale the Project Kuiper export compliance program through development of effective and efficient processes that support the pace of innovation and business that Amazon and its customers have come to expect. TITLE: Cloud Support Associate Intern (Japanese Fluency), Premium Support
QUALIFICATIONS: Currently enrolled in an Associate or greater undergraduate degree program (e.g., Associate degree, Bachelor’s degree) with a graduation conferral date between December 2023 and August 2024 Experience with at least one functional scripting language (e.g., Perl, Python, Ruby, shell scripting) Experience or coursework in networking Experience or coursework with operating systems Knowledge of internet fundamentals and cloud computing concepts Familiarity with Database, Storage, and Big Data concepts Experience troubleshooting networks (e.g., TCP/IP, DNS, routing, switching, firewalls, LAN/WAN, traceroute, iperf, dig, cURL or similar/related technology)
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONNOTE: By applying to this position, your application will be considered for all Cloud Support Associate Intern roles in Seattle, WA.Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the market leader and technology forerunner in cloud services. Our Cloud Support team provides technical support to our customers across the globe. We are looking for technical interns to help accelerate our growing Cloud Support business. This is an excellent opportunity to join one of Amazon’s technical teams, working with some of the best and brightest engineers, while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies. What you will do: The Cloud Support Associate Internship is a training program for the Cloud Support Associate role. Interns in this program benefit from the opportunity to gain experience with AWS cloud services including EC2, load balancers, and S3 storage solutions. They collaborate with AWS engineers and their peers in a virtual classroom to learn about AWS services and practice troubleshooting techniques. You’ll have an opportunity to apply your new skills through customer case simulations. Upon successful completion of the internship program, select interns will receive a full-time offer to join as a Cloud Support Associate. Are you ready to embrace the challenge? Come build the future with us. Amazon internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks, starting May-June 2023. Applicants should have at a minimum one quarter/semester remaining after their internship concludes, with a graduation date between December 2023 and August 2024. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. For an update on your status, or to confirm your application was submitted successfully, please login to your candidate portal. Please note that we are reviewing a high volume of applications and appreciate your patience. TITLE: Sr. Manager, Tax Modeling
QUALIFICATIONS: 10+ years of experience in tax, finance or a related analytical field. BA/BS degree required Licensed CPA, J.D., LL.M., PhD, MBA, or MS in Computer Science from an accredited college/university CISA (Certified Info Systems Auditor); CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional); CFE (Certified Fraud Examiner); CFF (Certified in Financial Forensics); CORPTAX (CORPTAX Certified Professional); TCERTIMP (Thomson Certified Implementer); Alteryx Analytics Designer Core and Alteryx Designer Advanced Knowledge of a broad range of corporate tax matters, domestic and international, along with a working understanding of state and local tax concepts, and possess both tax and technology skills Exceptional Excel modeling skills Deep knowledge of corporate tax laws, including domestic and international, along with a working understanding of state and local tax concepts Strong communication skills and ability to articulate complex tax laws in a business setting Strong technical, analytical, and problem solving ability Ability to multi-task between large, complex projects Experience working in a large public accounting firm, law firm, or large multi-national corporation Strong technical writing and federal/international tax research skills
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon is seeking a capable and motivated individual to be a Senior Manager on the M&A Tax team, with a deep and varied focus on tax modeling using a variety of technology applications. This position is available for Seattle, Arlington, or New York City.The candidate will be responsible for building tax models using a combination of technology applications in support of all planning projects, including acquisitions, dispositions, corporate restructurings, tax policy changes, etc. In addition, the candidate will be responsible for building operating models to evaluate the impacts of various tax regimes on Amazon’s business. This position will be part of a team that works closely with business partners and members of the tax department to structure and support various business initiatives and transactions.Key Duties and Responsibilities:Create and develop complex tax models and concisely summarize results to Tax and/or Finance leadershipWork across all tax groups, including M&A, Tax Planning, Tax Policy, Reporting and Compliance, and Tax ProvisionResearch the state, US federal and non-US tax implications of corporate tax projects, including but not limited to acquisitions and restructuringsDevelop strong working relationships among cross-functional teams, including Accounting, Financial Planning and Analysis, and Corporate DevelopmentWork to understand overall operational, data, and information requirements for tax planning, including analyzing tax data/calculations/reports, and understanding Amazon's technology environment and interfaces

TITLE: Technical Customer Service Specialist, Amazon Dedicate Cloud (ADC) Customer Service
QUALIFICATIONS: Current, active US Government Security Clearance at the TS/SCI level with polygraph. 1+ year experience in Customer Service and/or Account Management working with high-profile customers Proven experience with MS Excel Experience in leadership and/or account management positions A drive to dig into the details of a system or process to solve customer problems Proven success in a fast paced support environment Demonstrated success driving cross-functional deliverables SQL and/or other relational database experience Strong fluency with Web Technologies and the Internet Understanding of cloud based compute and storage concepts Experience taking ownership and driving resolution on escalated customer issues Excellent oral and written communication skills Exceptionally strong customer handling, conflict resolution, and problem solving skills; focus on quality in customer experience
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONDo you enjoy helping U.S. Intelligence Community agencies implement innovative cloud computing solutions and solve technical problems? Would you like to do this using the latest cloud computing technologies? Do you have a knack for helping these groups understand application architectures and integration approaches, and the consultative and leadership skills to launch a project on a trajectory to success? Are you familiar with security best practices for applications, servers, and networks? Do you want to be part of a customer facing technology team helping to ensure the success of Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a leading technology platform? Amazon.com was recently voted #5 most admired company in the US, #1 most innovative, and # 1 in Customer Service. Amazon’s technology business has a history and tradition of leading the world in Web-related technologies and services. Now, with Amazon Web Services (AWS) you have the chance to help individuals and businesses take their computing infrastructures and applications into “the Cloud”. As a member of the AWS Support team, you will be at the forefront of Cloud technologies with interactions with the full breadth of AWS services. You will be surrounded by people that are incredibly smart, passionate about cloud computing, and believe that world class support is critical to customer success. AWS Customer Service provides global support to a wide range of commercial and government customers as they build mission-critical applications on top of AWS services such as Amazon EC2 and Amazon S3. As an AWS Customer Success Representative, you'll engage with US Government (USG), and enterprise customers, providing training, support and analysis. You will work with the other members of the AWS Enterprise team including Technical Account managers (TAM’s), Sales and Solution Architects. You will be the Subject Matter Experts on Enterprise Account and Billing issues. You will proactively help customers avoid potential issues. Dive deep to understand the underlying issues to help a customer resolve problems. TITLE: Business Contracts Manager, WWPS Business Contracts
QUALIFICATIONS: BASIC QUALIFICATIONS6+ years of developing, negotiating and executing business agreements experience; Bachelor's degree; 6+ years of contracts management or other comparable experience with US Government Contracts with a focus/in depth knowledge of Federal contracting (FAR/DFAR). 5+ years experience managing IDIQ type contracts. Bachelor's Degree Current, active US Government Security Clearance of TS/SCI with Polygraph PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSExperience with FAR, DFAR, all government contract types, UCC, commercial contracts, and cradle to grave process. Experience reviewing and negotiating legal terms of a broad range of enterprise technology commercial contracts. Ability to demonstrate sound judgment, even in ambiguous situations. Ability to work independently while being able to contribute. Successfully contribute to cross-functional teams. Excellent organizational skills, ability to manage multiple projects at once, follow through, and meet deadlines. Strong written and oral communication skills. Strong analytical and computer skills. Experience with Sharepoint and SalesForce.Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon Web Services (AWS) is the leading cloud provider, providing virtualized infrastructure, storage, networking, messaging, and many other services to customers all over the world. AWS runs a globally distributed environment, operating at massive levels of scale. Businesses, from startups to enterprises, run their operations and applications on AWS’s multi-tenant infrastructure. Governmental organizations also look to and depend on AWS for cloud solutions and services.We have an immediate opening for a Contracts Manager to support the AWS World Wide Public Sector team focusing on National Security customers. This position will be based in Arlington, VA. This position has a strong focus on pre and post award contract management. Responsibilities will include maintaining contractual opportunities and assisting in the formulation of contract policies, procedures, methods, operating practices, and performance standards for a variety of federal programs. You will participate in and oversee team review of all customer contractual and purchase documents, coordinate legal activities for contract/agreement negotiation and support bid process in reviewing RFPs and ensuring ability for contract compliance. You will maintain contract records/files and manage, track and ensure compliance with all contractual obligations. This person will have a strong desire and ability to develop and implement tools and automation in contracting operations in order to increase efficiency and sales productivity. You will also support the sales team in helping to educate government contracting officers on AWS cloud services and advise them on the AWS cloud contracting model and issues and approaches to cloud computing with respect to commercial terms and conditions as well as acquisition policy and regulations.• This position requires that the candidate selected be a US Citizen and must currently possess and maintain an active TS/SCI security clearance with polygraph.Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded employee and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

TITLE: AMER Event Productions, Event Producer
QUALIFICATIONS: 3+ years of program or project management experience Experience using data and metrics to determine and drive improvements Experience working cross functionally with tech and non-tech teams 3+ years of experience on-site live event production or event management 2+ years experience with comm systems and calling a show 2+ years experience leading teams of (2-12 people) 2+ years project management and organizational skills 2+ years knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, event planning platforms and calendaring systems Raises the bar with both verbal and written documentation Able to clearly communicate and collaborate with team members and customers in a corporate environment Demonstrated ability to maintain and manage complex calendaring systems and databases Proficiency with audio, video, lighting and staging systems, including livestream operations Scheduling and calendaring management Familiar will event billing processes Desire to travel across AMER Experience with network systems and virtual event operations 35% availability to travel across AMER to venues and locations Strong desire to learn new technologies and systems Strong analytical skills, detail oriented, and demonstrated ability to improve processes Able to step in to stage management and/or backstage management as needed Experience opening new event venues, studios, or production related services
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONThe AMER Event Productions Event Producer provides customer-centric event production services and support, at the highest level possible, for the Event Productions team and its customers. They bring critical production planning and operational support to companywide events across AMER. In this role, the Event Producer provides assessment, planning, and operational management of east coast events, across both on campus and off campus locations. They are the primary point of contact for the customer, responsible for the booking assessment, planning, on-site operations, show calling, live event operations, and post-production requirements. Successful team members step seamlessly into a corporate events environment, have strong organizational skills, ability to work across multiple teams and cultures, demonstrate impeccable customer service, and are energetically driven to meet the needs of their customers and the team.Key job responsibilities• POC for team, customers, organizers, production engineers, livestream technicians, third-party production providers and over-hire labor• Available for customer meetings, onsite for set days, rehearsals, event day(s), through strike and load out operations• Manages meetings effectively; provides supporting documentation and aligns stakeholders• Maintains multiple operations calendars and databases• Improves efficiencies, and works to optimize standard processes• Coordinates and improves project-related data and reporting• Able to identify blockers, troubleshoot effectively, and facilitate progress• Seeks opportunities to help others improve skillsets and knowledge base• Manage Team Goals, and programmatic initiatives, with increased ambiguityA day in the lifePre-Event Discovery & Planning:• Collaborates cross-team to assess and approve incoming event requests with Producer(s) and Booking Team• Attends Discovery Calls and Planning Meetings with customer(s) and team, to understand the customers vision• Manages multiple scheduling and operational calendars, to ensure planning efforts• Manages and maintains prompt, thorough, professional communication with all team members, customers, and business partners throughout all phases of the eventPre-event Production:• Leads Planning Meetings with customers and team to confirm final event details• Provides production guidance to customers and team• Leads scheduling of production resources, services, and any post-production requests• Work on behalf of the customer to facilitate:Third party labor requests and equipment rentals• Communication with facility partners; Security, Housekeeping, Catering, etc.• Partner with internal team to ensure charge back• Event show flow preparation and distribution to internal teams• Manages any necessary technical testing or technical rehearsals• Able to support media playback and presentation methods• Clearly communicates with all team members and stakeholders• Coordinates personal travel arrangements, schedules, and expensesProduction: • Act as dedicated onsite POC for customers and organizers, including production team and third-party vendors• Leads event day show flow, and acts as producer show caller, or stage manager, calling the show through comm systems to the technical team• Provides direction of relevant facility operations• Leads onsite production engineers and over-hire labor through load in, pre-show operations, post-show wrap up and load out• Partner with the Systems Engineer to manage technical needs• Dynamically flex to customer needs and complications, escalates appropriatelyPost-event Production: • Oversee and manage proper strike of event venue• Manages post-event reporting • Manages post-event customer needs and meetings• Manages post-event expenditures• Provides key metrics and data to team and management

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon Web Services (AWS), a subsidiary of Amazon.com and a global leader in Cloud Computing, is seeking an experienced Sponsorship Program Manager to support our AWS Partners as they successfully grow their business on and with AWS. Our sponsorship programs continue to evolve and scale as we connect diverse AWS Partners with new programs built around in-person and virtual events as well as integrating them into additional marketing channels. You will play a critical role, working across the global AWS Marketing organization to build sponsorship programs, lead sponsorship initiatives, and maximize the ROI for our sponsors. In this role, you will look for engaging ways to incorporate AWS ecosystem partners and other third parties into AWS events in ways that drive high value ROI for the sponsors and enhance the experience for customers/attendees. You will define and own all elements of the sponsorship operating model and program including: strategy, prospectus design, demand generation, communications, sponsor enablement, sponsorship activation/execution and reporting and metrics. You will collaborate with other Geo Sponsorship Leads and the Head of AWS Field Sponsorships to ensure sponsorship programs are consistent on a worldwide level.The ideal candidate will have managed a robust sponsorship program and have evidence of being able to construct a compelling and clearly positioned portfolio of sponsorship opportunities, deliver on sponsorship revenue goals and create a high efficiency sponsorship function. This candidate must be strategic, with an operational mindset, and understand how to execute effectively. ** For more information on AWS, please visit http://aws.amazon.com Key job responsibilitiesJob Responsibilities • Drive the Sponsorship strategy for integrating ecosystem partners and other third parties into AWS events and other AWS marketing platforms in ways that provide strong ROI for sponsors and enhance customer experience. • Work with various groups within Marketing and Sales to inventory sponsorship opportunities and coordinate a strategy and portfolio of opportunities for sponsors. • Develop sponsorship project plans and manage all deliverables and timelines associated with the respected program.• Manage 3rd party event agency, helping with sponsor deliverables and communication.• Set and communicate sponsorship strategy to the event and marketing teams to ensure adherence to best practices and consistent partner experience• In collaboration with the Head of Global Field Sponsorships, build sponsorship strategy and executional plan for individual events and programs including prospectus development, revenue model, and sales plan.• Build and execute demand generation, communication and sales plans, own revenue target. • Build and maintain sponsorship program tools and processes to enable streamlined billing, contracting, communications, etc. • Design revenue model and own all financial reporting for program.• Dive deep to understand the AWS partner ecosystem to develop relevant sponsorship opportunities to the AWS partner ecosystem in ways that are meaningful for customers and sponsors. • Provide exceptional customer service to our sponsors.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAt Amazon, we strive to be Earth's most customer-centric company where people can find and discover anything they want to buy online. We hire the world's brightest minds, offering them an environment in which they can relentlessly improve the experience for customers. On the Event Production team, our fellow Amazonians are our customers and we enable them to work hard, have fun, and make history by providing them with leading-edge video conferencing and audio visual (AV) support in meeting rooms at Amazon locations around the globe. We also provide and support basic IT equipment and services they need to contribute in day to day duties As an EBC Event Service Engineer IV you will be working with the EBC program within AWS to facilitate in-person customer briefings designed to help customers accelerate their journey to the AWS Cloud. The engineer will be based onsite in AWS EBC in Seattle, and will be responsible for preparing meeting rooms and “day of” briefing meeting escalations.You will look for opportunities to standardize, improve productivity, reduce time to resolve, and reduce defects. A successful candidate will bring their experience with audio visual and video conferencing large scope of IT software, hardware, and networking disciplines into a fast-paced corporate environment.Travel up to 10% will be required. Key job responsibilitiesRegular activities and responsibilities include:• Windows/Mac OS support• User hardware/software/peripheral support• Creating and maintaining documentation• Provide break/fix support for Video Conferencing equipment in meeting rooms• Provide high level customers with assistance on using Video Conferencing technology• Coordinate equipment for meetings including video conferencing gear, displays, projectors, speakers, microphones, cameras, telephones, laptops, media players, document cameras, etc.• AV room furniture setup/strike and straightening including tables, chairs, lecterns, pipe and drape, easels, and other equipment as needed or directed • Assist customers with finding and scheduling appropriate meeting rooms• Train customers to use self-service tools to schedule their own spaces, services, and resources• Assist high level customers with finding event services including production, livestreaming and remote recording• Provide courteous phone and chat support to customers• Create and maintain excellent relationships with our internal customers and co-workers• Adjust work schedule when needed to support Amazon business needs.• Track your work via our ticketing system• Assist event organizers with presentation formatting• Responsible for resolving or escalating technical issues in EBC rooms

TITLE: Hardware Development Manager - Nitro SSD, Nitro SSD
QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's Degree in Electrical or Computer Engineer or a related technical field, or equivalent experience 7+ years of experience developing new hardware products, launching them and sustaining them. Proven experience taking complex integrated compute/networking products from concept to production to sustain, covering DFM, DFA, Continuity of supply, Operational excellence and recycle. System level architecture and system design experience. Experience managing teams of 8+ engineers distributed geographically across the US. Experience working with CM's and ODM's to drive product manufacture, qualification and integration. Master's Degree in a technical field with 10+ years of experience in server, storage system design, and complex electrical hardware system development across full product life cycles 10+ years experience with server, storage, networking, and/or large-scale distributed systems An understanding of AWS technologies Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon Web Services (AWS) Hardware Engineering team creates compute and storage server designs for Amazon’s innovative web services. The storage platform team develops and operates all the platforms for our major storage products (S3, EBS & EC2). Our designs are industry-leading in performance, frugality and operational excellence, and are critical to the success of the AWS business and the more than one million customers who use AWS today. Our success depends on our highly respected storage infrastructure; we’re handling massive scale and rapid integration of emergent technologies.We are looking for an experienced Hardware Development Manager to lead the Nitro SSD hardware platform that is deployed through various storage platforms across their entire lifespan from inception to retirement. Nitro SSD was announced at re:Invent 2021 (https://youtu.be/9NEQbFLtDmg?t=1735) and is the fastest growing vertically integrated NAND flash based storage solution at AWS. Why it matters: Public cloud IT services represent the majority of growth in the overall IT services market and will continue to do so for several years to come. The scale of AWS, combined with an understanding of how our hardware is used, creates a unique opportunity for customization that will directly benefit our customers.Why you will love it: You will work with teams across the company to enable the rapid development of next-generation storage solutions. You will be the single-threaded leader for the Nitro SSD hardware platform and all associated integration elements driving innovation at scale. You will have a direct impact on our bottom line and the ability to deliver improvements that directly impact our customers. You will lead part of a growing, fast paced, and fun team. You will have ownership for the implementation of your work. You will see direct product improvements based on the results of your work. Along the way, we guarantee that you’ll learn a ton, have fun and make a positive impact on millions of people.Key job responsibilitiesAs the manager of this team, you will lead a team of highly motivated hardware engineers and system development engineers that thrive on solving challenging problems with innovative solutions. The team owns the full hardware design and product development lifecycle for Nitro SSD, including high-speed mixed signal board design, component selection, validation, qualification, operations and sustain. The team drives platform integration and continuity of supply of the Nitro SSD product and associated system integration elements. As the manager of this team, you will closely with Platform Storage teams, Annapurna teams, Commodity and Supply-chain teams and our firmware and storage software teams to deliver bar-raising vertically integrated storage solutions for our customers. You will work with CM's and ODM's to drive the quality, availability and yields for the platform. A day in the lifeDrive product design, integration, qualification, launch and sustain of the Nitro SSD hardware and associated server integration elements. Work closely with Platform and Annapurna teams to define long-term product roadmap and deliver differentiated value-adds for our customers. Work with Supply-chain, Manufacturing Quality, CM's and ODM's to ensure continuity of supply and cost optimization while raising the quality bar for the product.About the teamNitro SSD teams are distributed across Seattle, Cupertino, Denver and Austin. The team builds and operates the Nitro SSD storage solution that is used by EC2 and EBS to deliver high performance, low-latency scalable storage for AWS customers. More about the product:re:Invent 2021 launch announcement by Peter DeSantis: https://youtu.be/9NEQbFLtDmg?t=1735What it is: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/aws/aws-nitro-ssd-high-performance-storage-for-your-i-o-intensive-applications/Value Proposition for Nitro SSDs: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a663Kx6jYzE

TITLE: Senior Marketing Manager, Livestream
QUALIFICATIONS: 6+ years of professional non-internship marketing experience Experience using data and metrics to drive improvements Experience with Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables) Experience communicating results to senior leadership Experience building, executing and scaling cross-functional marketing programs BA/BS 3+ years of experience leading a multi-functional digital marketing team or organization with direct oversight of some or all of the following: growth marketing, paid media, CRM, merchandising, brand, promotions, GTM execution, mobile app marketing (iOS and Android), partnership marketing, funnel optimization, creative development and/or e-commerce 3+ years of experience marketing digital consumer products, subscription and/or entertainment services MBA or equivalent work experience 8+ years of digital marketing experience Excellent knowledge of the music industry and music culture Effective leader and influencer who is able to foster a healthy team culture Ability to easily transition from high level strategic thinking to detailed execution Ability to lead large cross-functional projects across industry, product, engineering, BI teams and global marketing stakeholders. 2+ years of podcast, music streaming, SVOD or other entertainment industry experience 3+ years of mobile experience with consumer technology product or service
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAdditional locations include: [Culver City, CA], [Seattle, WA] or [New York City, NY].About Amazon MusicAmazon Music is an immersive audio entertainment service that connects fans, artists, and creators through music, podcasts, and culture. Amazon Music brings fans closer to what they love, with curated and personalized playlists, artist livestreams, artist merch, and Amazon Exclusive podcasts. Prime members get access to over 100 million songs in shuffle mode, All-Access playlists, plus the largest catalog of top ad-free podcasts, included with their membership. Customers can upgrade to Amazon Music Unlimited for full, on-demand access to 100 million songs in HD and a growing catalog of Ultra HD and Spatial audio. Anyone can listen to Amazon Music by downloading the free Amazon Music app, or wherever they listen to music including Alexa-enabled devices. Learn more at https://www.amazon.com/music.About the RoleAmazon Music produces and markets livestreams for some of the world’s top artists, including Kendrick Lamar, Drake, Kane Brown, and more. We are looking for a Senior Marketing Manager to lead our Livestream Marketing vertical. This role will lead go-to-market and campaigns that drive viewership and revenue to Amazon Music via artist livestreams. They will work cross-functionally with Amazon Music Marketing, Sales, Livestream Production, and Music Industry teams, as well as cross-Amazon businesses such as Prime Video and Twitch, to build and launch campaigns that delight millions of music fans worldwide. In addition to leading the development of cross-channel campaign GTMs, this person will build out key capabilities for the Livestream Marketing vertical that scale our approach and enable us to support more shows. This role will also lead all Livestream Marketing for our Thursday Night Football collaboration: Amazon Music Live.The right candidate will possess mastery of O&O and paid marketing channels, brand marketing principles, the music industry, and analytical skills that help us dive deep into data, sharpen our approach, and produce best-in-class campaigns. They will have experience working for consumer-facing technology companies and coordinating cross-functionally with large groups of stakeholders in ambiguous environments. They will need to prioritize effectively in a fast-moving and ever-changing environment, communicate clearly and persuasively, and have experience presenting to executives. Key job responsibilitiesAct as the lead campaign manager for the Livestream Marketing team, helping to build and launch campaigns across both O&O and paid channels.Be the key internal lead with both internal Marketing, Sales, Production, and Music Industry teams and cross-Amazon companies such as Prime Video and TwitchCreate and execute campaign GTM strategies that drive viewership and revenue to Amazon MusicCreate and manage experimentation and MarTech roadmaps that help us measure our campaigns, improve our approach, automate and scale.Drive the campaign post mortem process; develop and document key learnings, best practices and strategies; improve our marketing playbookAbility to communicate with people at all levels of the business; experience presenting in front of executive leadership

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONBy applying to this position, your application will be considered for all Data Engineering roles at all locations we hire for in the United States including but not limited to: Greater Seattle Area (Seattle, Bellevue, Redmond), Greater Bay Area (San Francisco, Sunnyvale, Santa Clara), Greater DMV (DC, MD, VA), Austin (TX), New York City (NY), Minneapolis (MN). Do you love building data pipelines? Are you excited by the opportunity to design tools and infrastructure needed to analyze large volumes of data? Do you want to help solve big data warehousing problems, and partner with stakeholders to understand how to best design and implement cutting edge data solutions that provide answers to key business questions? Do you want to be a part of a fast-paced environment and contribute to one of the most visited sites on the Internet?If this describes you, consider joining us as an intern in the summer of 2023. Amazon is looking for a data engineer intern to join one our many lines of business. Amazon interns have the opportunity to work alongside the industry’s brightest engineers who innovate every day on behalf of our customers. You will be matched to a manager and a mentor. You will have the opportunity to impact the evolution of Amazon technology as well as lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your work will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in the company.In addition to working on an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in fun activities with other interns throughout the summer. No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your summer and learn in a real-world setting.Amazon internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks with start dates in May - July 2023. Applicants should have at a minimum one quarter/semester remaining after their internship concludes.We’re on the lookout for the curious, those who think big and want to define the world of tomorrow.At Amazon, you will grow into the high impact, visionary person you know you’re ready to be. Every day will be filled with exciting new challenges, developing new skills, and achieving personal growth.How often can you say that your work changes the world? At Amazon, you’ll say it often. Join us and define tomorrow.Key job responsibilitiesAs a data engineer intern, you will/may:• Design, implement, and automate deployment of our distributed system for collecting and processing log events from multiple sources.• Design data schema and operate internal data warehouses and SQL/NoSQL database systems.• Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, and dashboards that engineers, analysts, and data scientists use to drive key business decisions.• Monitor and troubleshoot operational or data issues in the data pipelines.• Drive architectural plans and implementation for future data storage, reporting, and analytic solutions.• Develop code based automated data pipelines able to process millions of data points.• Improve database and data warehouse performance by tuning inefficient queries.• Work collaboratively with Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and other internal partners to identify opportunities/problems.• Provide assistance to the team with troubleshooting, researching the root cause, and thoroughly resolving defects in the event of a problem.

Experience with theory and practice of information retrieval, data science, machine learning and data mining Master’s degree in BI, Finance, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance or related field required. In this role you will work with a team of Business Intelligence Engineers aimed at providing data driven business insights to inform our partner development strategy.You will drive impact by helping your team to focus on the right priorities, building mechanisms and dashboards to make data accessible to internal teams, and leading the development of strategic initiatives including marketing attribution models and impact measurement.You will be part of the Ads Partner Development and Marketing org and will work closely with stakeholders including marketing, product, finance, and partner development teams. This highly visible and strategic role will require you to use SQL, ETL, data warehouse concepts, data modeling, business analysis, reporting, scripting, descriptive & inferential statistics to create business insights. You will need to be savvy about leveraging large data sets, defining BI requirements, and building scalable and automated dashboards to provide self-service BI capability to your stakeholders. DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONWould you like to build the AWS Cloud Computing business for the US Army and Department of Defense (DoD)? Would you like to be part of a team focused on cloud transformation and adoption of Amazon Web Services by engaging with key DoD customers, systems integrators and solutions providers who are reinventing their IT strategy by adopting and delivering cloud computing solutions? As a Sales Executive for Amazon Web Services (AWS), you will have the exciting opportunity to help shape enterprise solutions and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of Amazon’s utility computing web services including Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, Amazon Amazon RDS, Amazon Lambda, etc. In this role, you will: Develop a growing book of business in the US Army as part of a US Army sales team.Drive business and technical relationships and close business at a rapid rate by helping to define, identify, and pursue key opportunities.Establish deep business and technical relationships through your knowledge of the customer’s mission and the environment.Have day-to-day interactions with these customers.Have both a business background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at senior military and civilian levels.Have a technical background that enables them to easily interact with staff officers, contracting officials, software developers, and architects.Have experience thinking strategically about the mission, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.Be able to travel as necessary.Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future. This position requires that the candidate selected be a US citizen and obtain and maintain a security clearance.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAbout Us:Twitch is the world's biggest live streaming service, with global communities built around gaming, entertainment, music, sports, cooking, and more. It's where millions of people come together to chat, interact, and make their own entertainment.We're about community, inside and out. You'll find coworkers who are eager to team up, collaborate, and smash (or elegantly solve) problems together. We're on a quest to empower live communities, so if this sounds good to you, see what we're up to on LinkedIn and Twitter, get interviewing tips on Instagram, and discover projects we're solving on our Blog.About the Role:Data is central to Twitch's decision-making process, and data engineers operate at the forefront of this by creating authoritative datasets that drives analysis and decision-making across all of Twitch. In this role you will be shaping the way that business performance is measured, defining how we transform our data, and scaling analytics methods and tools to support our growing business, leading the way for high quality, high velocity decisions.For this role, we're looking for an experienced data engineer to join our Content Data Science team, which is focused on empowering staff throughout Twitch to use and trust our business data. Your responsibilities may range from developing and enhancing our data warehouse which act as authoritative sources of truth across the company, driving data quality and trustworthiness across product verticals and business areas, building self-service business intelligence infrastructure for analysts, as well as connecting into data interfaces that enable everyone in Twitch to discover and analyze the data. In the process, you will have the opportunity to interact with technical and non-technical staff members throughout the company, and will report to the Director of Content Data Science.This position can be located in San Francisco, CA; Irvine, CA; Seattle, WA; New York, NY; and Salt Lake City, UT.You Will:Define and own team level data architecture for trusted, governed, dimensionally-modeled repository of data that enables Twitch staff to quickly and reliably answer their business questions. Keep existing data sources fresh against data quality issues, design, develop and maintain data quality assurance framework and continuously improve the processes for developing new ones raising the level of quality expected from our work. Conduct unit, integration, and system tests on our data sources in order to validate data against source systems, and continuously optimize performance in order to improve query speed and reduce cost. Improve search, discovery and literacy: Create exploration and visualization interfaces in our BI tools and evangelize the adoption of these sources across the company through education and training programs.Improve business and engineering team processes via data architecture, engineering, test, and operational excellence best practices. Make enhancements that improve data processes.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONProject Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low-latency, high-speed broadband connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world.The Kuiper Solutions Engineering team (KSET) is a multi-disciplinary technology team involved in developing and delivering targeted and scalable solutions for custom satellite and ground applications. The Solutions Engineering team works closely with the core Kuiper team, and addresses the needs of specific customers (such as government agencies). The Senior Bus Avionics Engineer will engage with an experienced cross-disciplinary team to design, integrate, and test innovative product solutions. They will work closely with colleagues throughout Project Kuiper’s inter-disciplinary team, and collaborate with key partners and suppliers, in order to ensure our system exceeds customer expectations. The Bus Avionics engineer must be responsive, flexible, and able to succeed within a collaborative and fast-paced environment.As a member of KSET, the Senior Bus Avionics engineer will be responsible for new designs, analyses, trade studies, technology on-ramping, implementation and modification of Kuiper products, integration, verification, and validation of one or more of the following: the satellite bus, hosted payloads, interfacing with custom ground terminals, or custom user terminals. This includes testing, analyzing, and optimizing the particular satellite or ground element being developed, and ensuring that it meets the needs of the specific customer and/or target application.The successful candidate will have demonstrated experience working on large-scale programs with a diverse set of talented individuals, as well as with partner organizations (including government agencies). Key job responsibilitiesApplied system engineering with strength in bus avionics and electronics focusExperience with space platform electronic subsystem architecture, specification, design, integration, and testingKnowledge of space environmentExperience designing and analyzing electronic circuitsHands-on experience testing electronic subsystemsCreate test algorithms, scripts, and calibration routines as part of performing evaluation of integrated payloads or sub-systemsAnalyze test data and engage with Kuiper, customers, suppliers, or partners evaluating product performance to provide feedback on improvementsPrepare reports documenting test results, test coverage and other KPI metrics, and communicate issues effectively with developers and managers.Experience with business development, capture, and program executionCritical thinker with prudent risk tolerance to balance technology with requirements, cost, and scheduleCompetitive spirit accepting of challenges with a willingness to learn from mistakes, and mentorProven ability to work in a small team environmentStrong written and oral communication with experience presenting in technical meetingsThe role is located in Northridge, CA, and includes US relocation benefits.Security Clearance: Candidates must be able to obtain and maintain a US Government security clearance of TS/SCI, so you must be a U.S. citizen for consideration”.About the teamKSET is a multi-disciplinary technology team established to rapidly address the needs of targeted customers with specific solutions that have the potential to scale.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAbout TwitchLaunched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We’re always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on Linkedin, Twitter and on our Blog.About the Role Twitch is building the future of interactive entertainment. As a Software Engineer you'll work as part of a team to build the system that connects our creators with hundreds of millions of Twitch viewers. We're looking for interest and experience in server-side programming (web architecture, SOA, database architecture) and passion for building clean, scalable, and well-tested systems using Golang and AWS. This position can also be located in Irvine, CA; Seattle, WAYou Will: Design, deliver, and improve performant, reliable, and high-performance systemsEmbrace and champion engineering best practices within your group and TwitchProduce clean, high-quality code, tests, and documentationActively participate in code and design reviews with peers and partnersContribute engineering input and feedback into product planning processesPartner with fellow engineering teams to accomplish complex projects together
