The successful candidate will have a strong knowledge base of communications networks, and an insatiable curiosity for learning new technologies and legal issues. Working closely with the Kuiper team and across Amazon, this Corporate Counsel will develop out-of-this-world strategies for handling legal issues in creative, business-centric ways, as well as build processes that address risk and allow Kuiper the flexibility and freedom to move quickly.We are looking for someone who is enthusiastic about technology, enjoys being continually challenged, and demonstrates sound judgment even in ambiguous situations. This position may be based in Arlington, VA (HQ2), Redmond, WA, or New York, NY, Earth. Some travel, domestic and international, may be required. No intergalactic travel is yet required.Export Control Requirement:Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

TITLE: IT Support Associate II
QUALIFICATIONS: BASIC QUALIFICATIONS-1+ year experience in maintaining laser printers-1+ year experience with Cisco/networking and either Linux and/or Microsoft-High School or equivalent diploma-1+ year of practice in the set up and installation of computer and networking equipment in a professional environment CompTIA A+, CompTIA, Network +, Cisco/CCNA, Linux (Redhat), Microsoft hardware (installation) or other IT industry standard certifications Experience troubleshooting integrated and interdependent computer systems Experience maintaining zebra thermal printers, troubleshooting thin clients, PCs, scanners, and portable handheld terminals Ability to prioritize work based on department and production objectives Service Management, Project Management, and Inventory Management skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to work, prioritize and make decisions independently in a fast-paced production environment
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAbout OpsTech ITOperations is at the heart of Amazon’s business. We are known for our speed, accuracy, and exceptional service. Our buildings deliver tens of thousands of products to hundreds of countries worldwide, every day. OpsTech IT provides nonstop global IT support to Amazon Operations as a vital piece to the puzzle. We are looking for self-motivated individuals to take on new challenges and motivate teams in fostering solutions to the hurdles we face. Together, we take ownership for what we do — whether supporting IT infrastructure, developing new technology in-house, launching a new Amazon Operations facility, or delighting our customers by delivering packages directly to them.About The RoleAs an IT Support Associate II, you will use your skills to support the operations team in resolving technical problems within an Amazon Operations facility that span across a multitude of technical disciplines. We are committed to improvement; you will be encouraged to participate in career development opportunities as presented to progress your career at Amazon.What Do We Offer?Amazon offers competitive compensation packages including comprehensive healthcare benefits starting on Day 1, matching 401(k) program, and up to 20 weeks of paid parental leave. But wait, there’s more: we don’t wear suits and ties! Come as you are because jeans, t-shirts, sneakers and sometimes a neon safety vest will be your daily outfit.Key job responsibilitiesResponsibilities include, but are not limited toAllocating, maintaining, and troubleshooting of IT equipment used in Amazon Operations facilities.Handling support requests and procedures across the network.Assisting in training new hires.Continuous learning of new technologies.Supporting customers from multiple buildings in the area, as well as remote customers.Moving up to 49lbs as well as standing and walking for shifts lasting up to 12 hours.

TITLE: Sr. Hardware Development Engineer, Annapurna Labs
QUALIFICATIONS: BS or MS degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering (EE / CE) and Minimum of 5 years of experience with High Speed design and system validation Experience with Schematic and layout tools, Drive ODM HW development and testing and be part of the Production flow definition team Strong knowledge in electrical engineering fundamentals, power & signal integrity, and analog/digital circuits and able to drive component selection and validation of electrical, mechanical components, cables Experience with DDR Electrical characterization testing and production Qualification. Experience with High Speed 25/50/100Gbps networking solutions Define and Manage ODM Production testing CPU architecture experience
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon Web Services provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. We have data center locations in the U.S., Europe, Singapore, and Japan, and customers across all industries. We are seeking experienced Hardware Design Engineers to build the next generation of our cloud server infrastructure. Our success depends on our world-class server infrastructure; we’re handling massive scale and rapid integration of emergent technologies. As a member of the Machine Learning Acceleration team you’ll be responsible for the design and optimization of hardware in our data centers. You’ll provide leadership in the application of new technologies to large scale server deployments in a continuous effort to deliver a world-class customer experience. This is a fast-paced, intellectually challenging position, and you’ll work with thought leaders in multiple technology areas. You’ll have high standards for yourself and everyone you work with, and you’ll be constantly looking for ways to improve your products performance, quality and cost. We’re changing an industry, and we want individuals who are ready for this challenge and want to reach beyond what is possible today. Responsibilities: We are looking for a Hardware Design Engineer with strong skills in both hardware and software. In this role you will be responsible for system validation and integration of hardware in the AWS fleet through its entire life cycle. You will work cross functionally with AWS monitoring teams, members of the Hardware Design team, and additional teams across AWS to improve quality and reliability of products operating in the fleet. About the teamAbout UsInclusive Team CultureHere at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. Work/Life BalanceOur team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives. Mentorship & Career GrowthOur team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

TITLE: Sr. Component Engineer, Rack Power
QUALIFICATIONS: BASIC QUALIFICATIONS• Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or related field• 7+ years of experience as Electrical or Component Engineer• 5+ years of experience required in cloud computing, automotive, or industrial controls industry• 5+ years of experience in electrical component validation• Experience selecting alternative parts, creating qualification plans and obsolescence analyses• Experience with Product Life management tools• Experience in electrical component selection PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS• 6+ years professional experience developing electronics products• 5+ years of experience in failure analysis• Enjoys working side by side with partners, colleagues and teams on tough problems• Experience in communicating with vendors, development teams, senior management, and other technical teams• Record of mentoring other engineers to maintain architectural vision and software quality• Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role• Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this roleWhy AWS?About AWSAmazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.Inclusive Team CultureHere at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to celebrate our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.Work/Life BalanceWe value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud. Mentorship & Career GrowthWe’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $114,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $212,800/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONThe AWS Rack Power team is driving rapid innovation in the power systems used by Amazon Web Services. Our designs are fundamentally changing the data center, providing operational and financial benefits that are critical to the success of the AWS business and its millions of customers. We design and build power equipment used by Amazon.com and AWS services such as EC2, EBS, S3, Glacier, and Outpost. Our engineers solve challenging technology problems, and take big bets on new concepts, enabling AWS services to continue to revolutionize the industry.What you will do: Amazon is looking for a Senior Component Engineer to be responsible for Component research, Component Selection and working with cross functional teams to validate AVL component candidates. This role will be responsible for setting up our internal Component Selection processes and stage gates to ensure highest design conformity, system reliability and best cost modeling. The engineers within our team are instrumental in to help drive the stability and sustainability of AWS next-generation power systems and to discover innovative ways to automate and scale telemetry and monitoring services as AWS expands globally.Senior Component Engineers are expected to develop best practices, refine operational procedures and constantly innovate proactively. You will be responsible for Electronics component research, component Selection and working with cross functional teams to validate AVL component candidates. Our ideal candidate is autonomous, detail oriented, possesses strong written and verbal communication skills and has experience working at scale. Senior Component Engineers work hand-in-hand with multiple teams and design disciplines to invent new ways of operating Amazon's Next-Generation Network while never losing sight of the high security bar our customers demand.This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon's world class technical teams, working with some of the best and brightest engineers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies anywhere.You will provide Technical guidance and support to Design Engineering, Supply Chain, and Manufacturing as a Subject Matter Expert in Electrical Components Selection and Qualification. As a Senior Component Engineer, you will become familiar with technologies and apply to the component selection, development, qualification, and Parts Lifecycle Management. You’ll also review and approve all new Electrical Component Requests to assure they meet Internal Requirements, and own Electrical Component Lifecycle Management.Why it matters: Amazon has thousands of unique services, both big and small that power the Retail website (Amazon.com), Amazon Web Services, Echo, Kindle, Amazon Instant Video and more. These services run on hardware around the world. We continually need to deploy newer, innovative, and more efficient and cost effective hardware. Your work will drive efficiency, contributing to Amazon's Climate Pledge. Your work will drive significant cost savings while improving the performance and reliability of our websites and services. Your work will ensure the highest reliability of power equipment.Why you will love it: You will have exposure to teams and leaders across the entire company. You will be a part of a leading edge product development team. You will see many aspects of the Amazon business. You will have a direct impact on our bottom line and the ability to improve things for our developers. You will be part of a growing, fast paced and fun team. You will have ownership and responsibility for defining and executing processes that deliver both savings and productivity for Amazon.*Seattle is preferred location but can also be based out of Austin, TX., or Herndon, VA.

TITLE: Amazon Robotics - Tech Product Manager Co-op (MBA) - Fall 2023, Robotic Manipulation Organization
QUALIFICATIONS: BASIC QUALIFICATIONS* Currently working towards MBA* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Robotics or related Engineering fields* May 2024 graduation date or later* Currently enrolled in College/University and must have at least one semester/term/quarter of school left to complete after the end of the co-op* Must be eligible and available for a full-time (40h / week) 6-month co-op from July to December 2023* Ability to work with engineering community in the organization to gain consensus on technical decisions around new ideas for implementation. * A background (2+ years) in product management or equivalent field. * Experience working on multiple product lines that span both SW and HW* Experience working with engineering teams to define, scope and prioritize product requirements PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS* Experience with UX and/or Industrial Design* Experience with Human Machine Interaction* Strong verbal and written communication skills* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to prioritize conflicting requirements* Ability to multitask and prioritize critical tasks and conflicting requirements with a high attention to detail.* Successful history of shipping innovative products* Demonstrated analytical and quantitative skills, ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases.* Sound business judgment, proven ability to influence others, and strong analytical thinking skills are critical to success in this position.* Owner mentality and an entrepreneurial drive; demonstrated ability to have fun and inspire team members to enjoy work, be action-oriented and stretch their imagination.Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAre you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers who work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling, and fun. Amazon Robotics empowers a smarter, faster, more consistent customer experience through automation. Amazon Robotics automates fulfillment center operations using various methods of robotic technology including autonomous mobile robots, sophisticated control software, language perception, power management, computer vision, depth sensing, machine learning, object recognition, and semantic understanding of commands. Amazon Robotics has a dedicated focus on research and development to continuously explore new opportunities to extend its product lines into new areas. This role is a 6 month co op to join AR full time (40 hours/week) from July to December 2023. Amazon Robotics Co-op opportunities will be based out of the Greater Boston Area in our two state-of-the-art facilities in Westborough, MA and North Reading, MA. Both campuses provide a unique opportunity to have direct access to robotics testing labs and manufacturing facilities.The Technical Product Management team partners closely with software and hardware engineering teams and is responsible for defining product requirements for the development of the latest technologies for Amazon Robotic Fulfillment Centers. The team is also responsible for creating strategic product roadmaps, serving as Voice of the Customer, and evaluating and prioritizing new feature requests.The Product Management Co-op will work to understand customer needs for workcell operation and interfaces. They will also work to re-define the Operational Maintenance and support of Manipulation products- long-term and short-term; both preventative and reactive. This role requires excellent communication, project management, and technical skills to process information from multiple stakeholders, understand technical product features, and communicate effectively across the organization.The ideal candidate should love robotics, will have great technical judgement and knowledge and be prepared to visit some Amazon sites across USA for direct customer interaction and in-person understanding of the product. Key job responsibilitiesThe Co-op will be responsible for:* Identification of Product opportunities and determination of operational and systems requirements* Working with internal support, Ops and engineering teams, using a mixture of simulation, technical analysis, data and high judgement to guide the key decisions about the product to maximize value to operations. * Create team KPIs, goals, and analysis to monitor progress. Present analyses within the team and to organizational leaders.* Prepare user documentation and training documentation.About the teamThe Robotic Manipulation Organization develops technology that tackles some of Amazon's most challenging material handling problems at scale. We are a highly collaborative group, designing and delivering robotic manipulation solutions that integrate cutting edge perception and motion planning algorithms with state of the art hardware. Thinking big and delighting our customers motivates this group of passionate technologists.

TITLE: Gameplay Development Manager, New World
QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering (or equivalent) experience. 8+ years of professional software engineering experience, working on multi-discipline teams. 8+ years of Game industry experience. Shipped large scale multiplayer service-backed games. Experience with network performance profiling and optimization. Deep knowledge of asset pipeline and runtime representation. Comprehensive video game engineering skills including spatial reasoning, networking and pragmatic optimization.
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon is all-in on games, and our mission is to be the most customer-obsessed company in the games industry. At Amazon Game Studios, we’re creating compelling games like New World. New World is an Open World MMO that pits players against the haunted wilderness of Aeternum, a mysterious island in the twilight of the Age of Exploration. Success in New World ultimately depends on a player’s ability to conquer not only rival players, but Aeternum itself, as it unleashes undead legions, hell-bent on purging them from its shores. New World stands apart from other games in the genre by offering massive siege battles, thrilling supernatural invasions and a stunning and diverse natural setting.As a leader on our New World team, you will dive deep to create new experiences and opportunities for connection at massive scale. As a Gameplay Development Manager, you will manage a team of software engineers focused on gameplay features. You and your team will collaborate with engineers, designers, and artists to create clear, compelling content that contributes directly to the core of New World. You will be responsible for delivering game systems and workflows, achieving MMO performance and scale goals, and facilitating the testing required to deliver a high-quality result.Key job responsibilitiesBe responsible for designing, developing, deploying, and maintaining advanced online multiplayer related gaming technology focused on gameplay.Participate in technical discussions such as technical design reviews and code reviews.Enable a team of developers to build great gameplay on a massive scale and foster cross-team collaboration.Manage a team of engineers helping them grow their skills and advance their careers.Solve novel, ambiguously defined, difficult problems.Be a champion for the user: Insist on the highest standards and create functional and well-designed technology that delights our players.A day in the lifeAmazon Games applies the principles of Amazonian culture to the world of game design. We have a diverse team of talented, creative people pairing their love of making games with the unique strengths that come with being part of Amazon. Across all of our teams and locations, we are united by a common purpose: to share great gaming experiences with customers around the world. We believe in a future where everyone is a gamer and everyone can create, compete, collaborate and connect through games, and we are looking for the right people to help us build that future. With the power of Twitch and AWS at your fingertips, you will have the chance to innovate in gameplay, creativity, marketing, and technology, while working alongside some of the smartest and most creative minds in the industry.About the teamInclusive Culture, Work/Life Balance, & Career GrowthWe embrace our differences and are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We offer ten employee-led affinity groups with 190 global chapters, innovative benefits, and annual and ongoing learning experiences (including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences). Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance and offers flexible working hours. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. Additionally, our team is dedicated to supporting you with mentorship and pathways for ongoing development. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and are building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and promotes career choice.

TITLE: Principal Applied Scientist, Search and Science, AI
QUALIFICATIONS: PhD or Masters in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or Mathematics 10+ years of industrial/academic experience in deep learning, machine learning or a related field Demonstrated use of modeling and optimization techniques tailored to meet business needs Experience with leadership of experienced scientists as well as a record of developing junior members from academia/industry to a career track in a business environment Familiar with programming languages such as C/C++, Java, Perl or Python PhD degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or Mathematics 15+ years of industrial/academic experience in building speech recognition and natural language processing systems (e.g. commercial speech products or government speech projects) Demonstrated experience in managing an industrial research team for 5+ years Excellent written and verbal communication skills Solid track record of thought leadership and contributions that have advanced the field
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONThe Amazon Search team creates powerful, customer-focused search and advertising solutions and technologies. Whenever a customer visits an Amazon site worldwide and types in a query or browses through product categories, the Amazon Search services go to work. We design, develop, and deploy high performance, fault-tolerant distributed search systems used by millions of Amazon customers every day. Our team works to maximize the quality and effectiveness of the search experience for visitors to Amazon websites worldwide.

TITLE: Software Development Manager, AWS FinTech Roster
QUALIFICATIONS: 3+ years of engineering team management experience 7+ years of working directly within engineering teams experience 3+ years of designing or architecting (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience Experience partnering with product or program management teams BS in computer science/computer engineering or equivalent Experience with object oriented design and languages Track record of building and delivering mission critical, 24x7 production software systems Deep hands-on technical expertise Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong business and technical vision Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment Experience architecting systems on AWS platform a strong plus
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAs the single-threaded owner of AWS financial data and technology solutions, we build and operate systems that provide management and financial reporting for AWS. Our mission is to enable growth of earth’s largest cloud provider by building world-class finance technology solution for effective decision making. Our team owns the headcount management space and are part of the larger ecosystem of inter-connected products in the workforce planning and management functional space. Effective controllership combined with an optimal user experience is an absolute requirement to manage approved plan and hiring to successfully staff our Amazon businesses with the right talent at the right time. Our systems form the centerpiece of this ecosystem and establish the source of truth for approved plans. The products we own have grown to be business critical for AWS and Amazon businesses. Our largest and most passionate customer is AWS who has deemed our service mission critical. We are passionate about creating meaningful and delightful user experiences for our customers.Are you interested in building high-performance, globally scalable Financial systems that support AWS and Amazon's current and future growth? Are you seeking an environment where you can drive innovation? Do you have a passion for ensuring a positive customer experience? Then come join us.Key job responsibilitiesIn this role, you will be responsible for mentoring and coaching a team of software developers to create world-class systems that support Amazon's global footprint. You must be willing to insist on the highest standards for quality, maintainability, and performance. You will ensure that engineering best practices are followed and that software is designed to be highly available, dynamically scalable, and resilient to continuity threats.You will drive architectural and design choices and invent new features. We have a team culture that encourages innovation and we expect developers and management alike to take a high level of ownership for the product vision, technical architecture, and project delivery. Successful candidates will be high-bandwidth leaders who can cut through the noise, simplify relentlessly, deliver results, and build great teams around themselves.Key Responsibilities:Build and nurture a team of software developersShape team goals by developing a deep understanding of our customer's business processes and success criteriaDevelop and execute a long-term architecture while balancing short term commitmentsWork closely with the team to architect and develop the best technical design and approach to solve complex problemsEffectively partner with engineering and non-engineering groups across the organization to deliver on own goals

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONThe Metering and Bill Compute team provides the services that calculate bills for every customer on the largest cloud provider in the world. Customers will not receive accurate, timely, and consolidated billing data without our services. Discounts would be manually applied, and there would be no way for customers to see updated billing data daily. We consume almost 3B usage records per second and generate bills 3x more frequently than our next most significant competitor to give customers near real-time billing data. Beyond our impact on our customers and business, this space is filled with complex challenges to deliver billing accuracy at scale while remaining cost-efficient. We help drive accuracy for our Service teams by tapping into our quadrillions of data and using big data technologies to identify pattern anomalies. We are re-architecting how we compute bills by moving to a distributed architecture to achieve scale as we expand to more regions and add more customers. And we tackle these complex challenges using cutting-edge technologies such as EMR, Spark, and EKS.We are looking for a Senior Manager, Software Development, to lead the team in designing and building these systems and new initiatives.You will help establish technical standards and drive the overall technical architecture and engineering practices. You will work on all aspects of software development while focusing on the most challenging problems. You will build high-quality, architecturally sound systems aligned with our business needs.You will think big when designing and building the software, ensuring the software is evolving in the right long-term direction while bringing value to customers iteratively. You will coach, mentor, and guide the efforts of developers across multiple locations.You will independently lead broad cross-organization efforts from the early stages through release. You will influence organization roadmap priorities, system owners, and technical direction. You will represent difficult trade-off decisions and solutions to the senior leadership to help them understand decisions and options. You will leverage your technical knowledge to drive technical trade-off decisions. You will identify when a technical solution requires additional technical guidance.You will manage cross-functional and cross-organization communication to ensure all stakeholders are informed and needs are aligned. You will guide the technical direction and decisions to deliver a solution that meets Amazon's high standards for customer satisfaction, efficiency, stability, extensibility, simplicity, and operational excellence.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONProject Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low-latency, high-speed broadband connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world.The Kuiper Solutions Engineering team is a multi-disciplinary technology team involved in developing and delivering targeted and scalable solutions for custom satellite and ground applications. The Solutions Engineering team works closely with the core Kuiper team, and addresses the needs of specific customers (such as government agencies). The Senior SatComms Systems Engineer will play a pivotal role in the delivering innovative and fast-paced analysis and design solutions. The Senior Satellite Systems Engineer will work closely with customers and partners to fully understand satellite system level requirements. They will perform system level analysis and trade studies to optimize performance against customer requirements. The successful candidate will be adept at preparing proposals that take into account current and future customer needs. They will develop architectures and lead a multi-disciplinary team to execute on a complex set of requirements. The successful candidate will have demonstrated experience working on large-scale programs with a diverse set of talented individuals, as well as with partner organizations (including government agencies). DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONProject Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low-latency, high-speed broadband connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world. Come work at Amazon! The Role: As a Sr. system Architect in the Silicon development organization, you will engage with an experienced cross-disciplinary staff to conceive and design innovative product level solutions. You will work closely with an internal inter-disciplinary team, and outside partners to drive key aspects of product definition, execution and optimization. You must be responsive, flexible and able to succeed within an open collaborative peer environment. As a senior member of the Digital RF Systems team, you will be responsible for architecture, simulation, and End to End model implementation (Matlab/C/C++/System C/HDL) of hybrid and digital phased arrays beam forming systems. Based on system level constraints, you will develop a solution supporting high throughput / availability, low power, flexibility in capacity, and optimized for RF system constraints. Members of this team focus on the signal chain from modem interface to RF front-end module.You also will be providing reference models for the IC (Integrated Circuit) design team, be involved in the verification and validation of the algorithms and the Phased arrays systems from concept to production ready hardware and software. In this role you will: · Innovate for lowest power consumption and highest reliability · Develop and model Digital Signal Processing algorithms for FPGA and ASIC implementation, · Develop and model multi-beam beam-forming systems · Develop and model RF transceivers behavioral models · Develop and model impairments compensation and system calibration methods for the phased array system . Innovate to enhance in spectral efficiency and address RF impairments · Work collaboratively with network and communications systems as well as chip and Firmware implementation teams · Simulate / trade-off analysis / validate digital beam forming implementations and architectures · Bring up prototype and production systems in conjunction with implementation teams · Meet with vendors and technology suppliers to select technologiesExport Control Requirement:Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

TITLE: Investigation Specialist
QUALIFICATIONS: High School Diploma 2+ years of experience working with Microsoft products (Excel, Word, Powerpoint) 2 + years of experience performing data entry and analysis to identify root cause and implement solutions Basic SQL, excel and/or other data management systems knowledge Bachelor’s Degree Experience in a contact center environment Experience handling multiple key priorities at the same time Experience with fraud or risk investigations, or in payments/banking Knowledge of FBA and Seller Central
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONSellers are a critical part of Amazon’s ecosystem to deliver on our vision of offering the Earth’s largest selection and lowest prices. These Sellers offer hundreds of millions of unique products providing a broad and diverse inventory of products from Books, Electronics and Apparel to Consumables and beyond. Fulfillment By Amazon (FBA) enables Sellers to provide fast and efficient deliver to their customers using Amazon fulfillment services and now make up the majority of the business on Amazon.com. Amazon is seeking Investigation Specialists to join the FBA Seller Experience within the Supply Chain & Optimization Technology organization. We support Amazon’s Global Supply Chain process with investigative research involving Seller fee disputes, Seller requests for additional storage space, and contacts involving Inventory Management data issues and disputes. We believe consistency is the foundation to the world-class service we provide our Sellers and Inventory Planning & Control (IPC) is at the center of ensuring consistent and fair evaluation of Seller disputes. The IPC contact team consists of highly specialized investigators who support FBA through manual investigations world-wide with varying Seller pain points in the inventory cycle.An Investigation Specialist provides timeline resolution to the issue(s) in hand by researching and querying internal tools and by taking real-time decisions. An ideal candidate should be able to understand the requirements/be able to analyze data and notice trends and be able to drive the Seller Experience without compromising on time. The candidate should be able to communicate clearly in the written and oral form. An Investigation may interact with Technology on behalf of the Seller to resolve a Tech escalation, or work with Seller Support to improve a Seller communication or process to reduce Seller contacts.Key job responsibilities* Managing time effectively and independently to research Seller discrepancy requests, understand trends and call-out new or different trends in order to accurately resolve Seller issues.* Communicating with Sellers and FBA business partners effectively using clear and professional oral and written communication.* Document outcome of investigations with Sellers in a succinct and reliable method.* Conducting multiple investigations with Amazon Sellers daily that aim to resolve disputes while utilizing Excel.* Providing prompt and efficient service to Amazon Sellers including the appropriate escalation of Seller issues.* Maintaining accountability to attendance, productivity, and quality expectations while adapting to the changing requirements of the business.* Providing root cause resolution for FBA Seller and Customer issues.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAre you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to these questions and you'll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers who work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers experiences in ways we can't even image yet. We invent new improvements every day. This role is a 6 month co-op to join AR full time (40 hours/week) from July-December 2023. Come join us in North Reading, MA, or in our newly expanded innovation hub in Westborough, MA! Both campuses provide a unique opportunity for co-ops to have direct access to robotics testing labs and manufacturing facilities. Remote and hybrid flexibility is available for this role. Amazon Robotics empowers a smarter, faster, more consistent customer experience through automation. Amazon Robotics automates fulfillment center operations using various methods of robotic technology including autonomous mobile robots, sophisticated control software, language perception, power management, computer vision, depth sensing, machine learning, object recognition, and semantic understanding of commands. Amazon Robotics has a dedicated focus on research and development to continuously explore new opportunities to extend its product lines into new areas. Amazon Robotics Sensor Team is seeking a system development engineering co-op to assist with sensor system development and testing. The ideal candidate will have had experience with and interest in sensor technologies, possess good communication skills, and enjoy problem solving both independently and in team settings. Key Roles and ResponsibilitiesAssist an interdisciplinary team of engineers in the execution of product designs from concept to production including design, prototyping, validation, and integration.Develop sensor characterization procedures and automated test solutions.Drive experiments, data collection, perform system/sub-system level testing and evaluation.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONProject Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low-latency, high-speed broadband connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world.Product Design (PD) strives to constantly raise the bar on the customer experience. Product Design Engineers engage with an experienced cross-disciplinary team to conceive, design and bring to market innovative consumer products for the Kuiper program. Key responsibilities include electromechanical product design (from concept to end of life), validation, optimization and technology investigation while balancing against cost and meeting aggressive schedule. These positions isolate, define, and resolve known or unknown complex problems and implement those solutions efficiently and effectively. They often prioritize the allocation of scarce resources. Their decisions are reviewed from a strategic perspective by cross functional teams to collaborate and refine. Their work may affect large portions of the Kuiper workforce, either across the organization or within several major workgroups. They should have an understanding of all aspects of product design readiness, manufacturability, Dfx, and tooling design. They will scale solutions to ensure Kuiper CT has a robust methodology and process to deliver technology to products. They have the ability to communicate effectively and efficiently with PD members, cross functional teams, and executives. They should be a role model for younger engineers and mentor to ensure best practices established by the organization are always world class. DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAre you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers who work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling, and fun.Amazon.com empowers a smarter, faster, more consistent customer experience through automation. Amazon Robotics automates fulfillment center operations using various methods of robotic technology including autonomous mobile robots, sophisticated control software, language perception, power management, computer vision, depth sensing, machine learning, object recognition, and semantic understanding of commands. Amazon Robotics has a dedicated focus on research and development to continuously explore new opportunities to extend its product lines into new areasThis role is a 3-month Internship to join AR full-time (40 hours/week) from May 22, 2023 to August 25, 2023.Amazon Robotics Internship opportunities will be based out of the Greater Boston Area in our two state-of-the-art facilities in Westborough, MA and North Reading, MA. Both campuses provide a unique opportunity to have direct access to robotics testing labs and manufacturing facilities.Key job responsibilitiesAmazon Robotics is seeking a self-motivated System Development Engineering intern student to work with us on the design of our next-generation automated systems. Using system modeling and decision-support tools you will join a team designing innovative systems that integrate advanced robotics technologies to support Amazon business needs and enhance overall customer satisfaction. The Systems Development Intern will help identify relevant modeling and analysis techniques, develop or integrate multi-domain quantitative models and present results that support system-level analysis, performance trade-offs, and decision-making.Working with internal stakeholders to understand needsCharacterize design problems and developing modelsAnalyzing and presenting results to help designers better articulate drivers of system performance or value by understanding key design trade-offs.

TITLE: Benefits Corporate Counsel, Labor and Employment
QUALIFICATIONS: 7+ years of benefits legal experience is required J.D. degree and membership in good standing in one state bar is required Law firm background counseling large clients with self-insured plans or in-house counsel experience supporting large self-insured plans Ability to demonstrate sound judgment even in ambiguous situations based on common sense and analysis of risk Strong written and oral communication skills Strong analytical and computer skills Excellent organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects at once, follow through and meet deadlines using pragmatic judgment in ambiguous situations Ability to work independently while being able to contribute successfully to cross-functional teams
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONWork hard, have fun and make history with Amazon's legal team. We are looking for an attorney with 7+ years employee benefits experience to help support our growing people experience and technology team and global benefits program. Employee benefits experience outside the US is a plus but is not required. You will serve as one of the primary lawyers responsible for supporting Amazon’s global benefits team with a focus on both US and non-US based health and welfare benefit and retirement plans. Your responsibilities will include counseling senior leaders, employee benefits professionals, and plan fiduciaries on day-to-day benefits matters, fiduciary compliance, plan governance, and legal compliance (e.g., compliance relating to ERISA, the Internal Revenue Code, COBRA, HIPAA, ACA and other federal laws as well as applicable state laws such as the SFHCO) and applicable country-specific compliance for health and welfare and retirement benefits offered outside the US (e.g., compliance relating to statutory and regulatory requirements for health and welfare and retirement benefits in each applicable country, and local insurance and/or pension requirements and associated contracts in each applicable country, etc.). You will also support due diligence, negotiation and implementation of M&A transactions with regard to employee benefit matters involving U.S. employees. Principal duties include but are not limited to advising the benefits team on daily matters, participating in long-term benefits planning, drafting and amending plan documents, reviewing SPDs, SMMs, and participant communications, as well as reviewing and negotiating benefits-related provisions in contracts with service providers. Responsibilities also include managing benefits litigation/subrogation, ERISA document requests, QDROs, QMCSOs, government agency investigations, audits and administrative charges, developing and delivering training, as well as the assessment and supervision of outside counsel. This position will work actively with internal clients and the business as well as our People Experience and Technology team and requires the ability to travel and work extended hours when necessary.This role will report to the Associate General Counsel, Labor & Employment.The preferred location for this role would be in Seattle, DC, NYC, Sunnyvale, or Santa Monica.P​​ursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.​​​​​​​​Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction record.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAt Amazon, we are committed to being Earth’s Safest Place to Work, Best Employer and Most Customer-Centric Company. To get there, we need exceptionally talented and empathetic leaders passionate about making every day better for all employees - and you would play a key role in that journey! Our Human Resources leaders care deeply about the employee experience and support employees and managers to focus on people through engagement, technology and innovation. As you start your career at Amazon, the HR Partner role in our Worldwide Operations People Experience and Technology (PXT) team can provide you with:Ability to influence change and foster an environment of inclusion for all employees.Skills in employee engagement and problem solving with diverse populations.Experience with working in a rapid and complex changing environment driven by continuous innovation.Knowledge and application of HR fundamentals.Partnering with leaders at multiple levels of the organization to develop forward looking strategies and goals focused on the employee experience.Experience in coaching and supporting leaders in onboarding and talent management.Exposure to a multi-faceted human resource organization to jumpstart your career.In this role, you will partner with front-line business leaders to innovate, implement and deploy HR strategies focused on employee engagement, internal customer service, talent management, organizational effectiveness and workforce planning. In addition, you will provide front-line support to our employee, PXT and leadership teams calling on HR expertise and empathy. To thrive, you will need a flexible skill set, including the ability to connect to the bigger picture while diving deep into the details and collaborate across many teams, levels, and situations.As a HR Partner, no two days look the same, but a typical day will most likely include the following responsibilities:Work with a team of hourly and senior PXT employees in creating a best in class employee experience (Onsite hourly team will not exist in all PXT business lines).Foster and role model an environment of inclusion for all employees.Advocate for employees’ success through end-to-end experiences that help employees feel fully engaged in the work they do and valued for who they are.Equitably exercise high-judgment, manage through ambiguity and serve as first point of escalation for employee concerns.Create and drive an active approach to impact change and innovation around employee engagement.Promote adoption of technology, self-service, change management and continuous improvement.Support employee queries and situations with discretion and expertise along with routine standard work around employee onboarding, performance management, engagement processes and benefits services.Provide effective internal and external customer service with focus on strong communication and business acumen.Coach, develop and support leadership through decision making with empathy and sound judgment through leadership 1:1s, roundtables and training.Collaborate with multiple levels of the organization ranging from front-line employees to senior leaders.Influence and guide partners to prioritize employee experience and customer obsession when innovating.Use data and metrics to identify trends, anticipate business needs and develop action plans, including attendance and attrition deep dive and planning.Proactively manage professional and personal development through continuous learning and training.Be ready to work hard while having fun!We might be a great match if you:Courageously advocate for equity when you see inequity in behavior or processes.Are excited to work in a fast-paced and team-oriented environment, it is always Day 1!Are passionate about interacting with and advocating for employees, leaders and HR teams who are working directly with products (everything from picking product, driving trucks or servicing a customer) to meet customer promise.Are excited by an active, non-typical work environment. You aren’t looking for a Monday through Friday job sitting at a computer all day... We are on the production floor engaging our teams, coaching our leaders and creating the earth’s best place to work!Are flexible in supporting our field workforce and able to work flexible schedules. PXT teams supporting our field workforce will work various hours and be aligned to the operational shifts of their client group. This includes working weekends, evenings, and rotating schedules based on business needs.Insist on the highest standards, have an outstanding work ethic, and desire to achieve excellence.We will support you through training and onboarding that will help teach you everything you need to know to be a successful HR Partner. Here are a few qualifications you should have from Day 1 with Amazon.

TITLE: Amazon Robotics - Technical Program Manager Co-op - Fall 2023, Robotics Manufacturing and Technical Operations (RMTO)
QUALIFICATIONS: BASIC QUALIFICATIONS* Pursuing a Bachelor’s/Master’s/Doctorate in an engineering major, supply chain management, or other equivalent discipline * May 2024 graduation date or later* Must be eligible and available for a full-time (40h / week) 6-month co-op between July - December 2023* Currently enrolled in college/university and must have at least one semester/term/quarter of school left to complete after the end of the co-op* Microsoft Office skills, including advanced knowledge of Excel PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS* Experience with Oracle or SAP ERP software* Experience working with SQL and Tableau analytics* Proven leadership skills with exceptional written and verbal communication skills to work internally and externally at all levels of management and with peers* APICS or Six Sigma Certification with an understanding of Lean Manufacturing processes Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAre you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers who work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling, and fun. Amazon Robotics empowers a smarter, faster, more consistent customer experience through automation. Amazon Robotics automates fulfillment center operations using various methods of robotic technology including autonomous mobile robots, sophisticated control software, language perception, power management, computer vision, depth sensing, machine learning, object recognition, and semantic understanding of commands. Amazon Robotics has a dedicated focus on research and development to continuously explore new opportunities to extend its product lines into new areas. This role is a 6 month co op to join AR full time (40 hours/week) from July to December 2023. Amazon Robotics Co-op opportunities will be based out of the Greater Boston Area in our two state-of-the-art facilities in Westborough, MA and North Reading, MA. Both campuses provide a unique opportunity to have direct access to robotics testing labs and manufacturing facilities.The Robotics Manufacturing and Technical Operations (RMTO) team is seeking a Technical Program Manager (TPM) co-op to develop and manage a comprehensive project portfolio to support high volume manufacturing and emerging products and technology. The Manufacturing team works with partner teams in early design stages and develops processes to launch and sustain manufacturing for complex robotics equipment. This role will work closely with manufacturing, technical operations, supply chain and finance teams to operationalize continuous improvement opportunities and generate financial impact. The role will have visibility and project ownership across warehouses and all manufacturing operations to lead critical planning activities for world class manufacturing execution. The role collaborates with leadership and stakeholders to develop performance metrics, drive best practices, and lead process and tool improvements that align with the strategic priorities of the team. Key job responsibilities* Actively support and foster a culture of inclusion* Actively participate in the discovery and intake triage of new manufacturing insourcing opportunities.* Develop and manage a consolidated project list of manufacturing opportunities across current and future programs.* Partner with cross-functional teams to develop operation plans for new projects and initiatives* Develop operating mechanisms to define and accelerate project timelines* Evolve and maintain standard operating procedures for manufacturing operations to support future program management in a high mix, high volume manufacturing environment* Support weekly, monthly and quarterly business planning cycles and track performance metrics/KPIs* Provide recommendations for operational improvements including utilization of ERP/system capabilities* Provide input in developing manufacturing strategies on existing products, new products, and product phase-outs* Partner with senior leadership to provide inputs for manufacturing business development* Ability to travel (~10%) to support projects when normal business travel practices resumeAbout the teamRMTO Business Operations (Biz Ops) team works across the Amazon Fulfillment Technologies & Robotics (FTR) department to enable manufacturing scalability and adaptability to best serve the Amazon Operations Network. Through strategic thought leadership, this team evaluates manufacturing constraints across the product/service portfolio to deliver solutions that optimize resource allocation to unlock customer value. Our team’s holistic and peculiar mindset allows us to develop the operational leaders of tomorrow while delivering results for our customers.

TITLE: Senior Power Optimization Engineer, Hardware Development team
QUALIFICATIONS: 7+ years of SOC Power Optimization Experience 5+ years of SOC Power Delivery 5+ hands-on Accelerators/CPU hardware experience GPU Experience ML Experience Master's Degree Strong analytical/problem solving skills and pronounced attention to details. Ability to work cross functionally to build consensus and alignment between multiple independent teams
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon Web Services provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. We have data center locations in the U.S., Europe, Singapore, and Japan, and customers across all industries. We are seeking experienced Hardware Design Engineers to build the next generation of our cloud server infrastructure. Our success depends on our world-class server infrastructure; we’re handling massive scale and rapid integration of emergent technologies.As a member of the Silicon Optimization Team you’ll be responsible for the design and optimization of hardware in our data centers. You’ll provide leadership in the application of new technologies to large scale server deployments in a continuous effort to deliver a world-class customer experience. This is a fast-paced, intellectually challenging position, and you’ll work with thought leaders in multiple technology areas. You’ll have relentlessly high standards for yourself and everyone you work with, and you’ll be constantly looking for ways to improve your products performance, quality and cost. We’re changing an industry, and we want individuals who are ready for this challenge and want to reach beyond what is possible today.Responsibilities:• Leverage diagnostics’ & real workloads to enable sub-system competitive analysis and identify opportunities for power improvement. • Define power studies & work closely with architects to analyze & implement them on current and future products • Develop simulation and conduct silicon measurement to validate SoC and system level power efficiency for variety of workloads. • Define new tests, test benches that can isolate power inefficiencies. • Work with verification and hardware teams to better leverage system hardware for SOC power validation and optimization. • Design and implement system power solutions that are data-driven to optimize system parameters such as efficiency, size, and cost. • Power characterization of SOC and system• Familiarity with modern SoC power delivery; power state management, power tradeoffs, throttling techniques, thermal constraints, etc.• Articulate tradeoffs encompassing electrical, mechanical, power, and thermalInclusive Team CultureHere at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. Work/Life BalanceOur team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.Mentorship & Career GrowthOur team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

TITLE: Sr. Radio Frequency Hardware Engineer, Kuiper Solutions Engineering Team
QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s Degree in RF, Microwave, or Electrical Engineering, or related discipline, or equivalent experience 10+ years of experience in RF design with successfully launched products, using tools like ADS or AWR Microwave Office Experience in wireless system design and architecture, system integration, RF system analysis 10+ years of experience in hardware development across the full product life cycle (concept to production) Experience with RF schematic and layout tools Master's or PhD degree in RF, Microwave, or Electrical Engineering, or related discipline Experience with current and upcoming RF standards in cellular (4G/5G), Wi-Fi, microwave backhaul, or similar broadband wireless standards Experience with communication theory, OFDM, MIMO, Digital/Wireless Communication Systems Experience with discrete RF LNA Design (stability, S/C/Ku/Ka-Band Frequencies) Experience with RF SSPA design, 5-to-10 Watt RF Power range (S/C/Ku/Ka-Band Frequencies) Experience with frequency synthesizers, high frequency Phased Locked Loops (PLL), mixers, attenuators, oscillators, filters Experience with integration of RF systems into aerospace/avionics enclosures Experience developing highly reliable RF/Microwave systems for extreme environments Experience with rapid iteration prototyping and joint hardware/firmware development; partnering with software engineers to bring-up and test new hardware designs Hands on experience with RF lab equipment including VNA, power meters, spectrum analyzers, vector signal generators Working knowledge of at least one programming language such as Python or C/C++ High sense of ownership, urgency, and drive; resourceful, and able to deliver results with minimal direction Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with business owners, and senior business leaders Demonstrated experience working with government agencies
DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONProject Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low-latency, high-speed broadband connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world.The Kuiper Solutions Engineering team is a multi-disciplinary technology team involved in developing and delivering targeted and scalable solutions for custom satellite and ground applications. The Solutions Engineering team works closely with the core Kuiper team, and addresses the needs of specific customers (such as government agencies). The Senior RF/Microwave Engineer will play a pivotal role in the team delivering innovative and fast-paced analysis and design solutions. The Senior RF/Microwave Engineer will be a member of the Solutions Engineering team, focusing on satellite system level analysis and the design of the various RF and Microwave circuit blocks in the range of Ka/K bands. They will be expected to lead a variety of tasks, from RF board design and component selection, to layout review and board bring-up and test. They will work across teams and support fellow engineers with design reviews and the preparation of joint reports and proposals. The candidate will have a sharp focus on the specific needs of the customer and be able to conduct trades and analyses to show that proposed solutions will meet the customer’s goals.The successful candidate will have demonstrated experience working on complex programs with a diverse set of talented individuals, as well as with partner organizations (including government agencies). The candidate will exhibit the potential to lead small sub-teams of RF/Microwave engineers, and be able to prepare easy-to-read and technically compelling written reports.The role is located in Northridge, CA, and includes US relocation benefits.Security Clearance: Candidates must be able to obtain and maintain a US Government security clearance of TS/SCI, so you must be a U.S. citizen for consideration.Key job responsibilitiesInteract directly with customers to understand technical requirements, and translate them into technically robust solutions backed by data and analysisResponsible for implementation of wireless system and physical layer performance of multiple wireless components. This includes the development and optimization of RF systems from baseband modems to antennaResponsible for designing RF and communications payloads on a commercial busIdentify top level customer requirements and ensure high quality and innovative designs are pursuedDevelop RF link budget, frequency planning, and filter requirements definitionPerform RF design and layout trade studies for satellite RF and Microwave sub-systems in the Ka/K range; contributing to overall system architecture including inputs and requirements from cross discipline teams (Mechanical, Electrical, Mechanisms, Materials, Manufacturing, Assembly, and Test)Facilitate cost trades on multiple parallel configurations for cost/manufacturability vs design uncertaintyDeliver well-written documentation, reports, and presentations for technical design reviews and as part of proposal effortsDesign and support test campaigns, both development and qualification/acceptance, for space hardwareAbout the teamKSET is a multi-disciplinary technology team established to rapidly address the needs of targeted customers with specific solutions that have the potential to scale.

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAmazon Web Services (AWS) is on a mission to help our customers innovate faster and easier. Our global team of diverse builders continuously accelerate the pace of cutting-edge cloud technology to help millions of businesses achieve their goals. We’re reshaping the IT industry so our partners can revolutionize the global marketplace. Let’s build the future together. We are looking for a Data Center Technician, to be the primary resolver for a support team. The Data Center Technician is skilled at troubleshooting hardware based problems. We are looking for you e to troubleshoot and solve a range of datacenter infrastructure issues including, but not limited to: hardware, fiber, networking, and related problems. With increased knowledge and experience you become an escalation point for junior technicians and become responsible for creating and maintaining documentation on technologies you support. Issues are escalated to the appropriate resolver groups when necessary. You understand common IT principles like computer architecture and the OSI model and are able to apply them to finding solutions to problems. You know how to innovate and make decisions on his/her own, but also know how to take direction when it is given, paying attention to all details involved. You are able to execute small projects on your own and work with your manager in planning and executing larger local projects. You act as an escalation point for junior technicians. You understand all aspects of the equipment you support. This position will fill an opening at one of multiple separate sites. This position requires that the candidate selected be a US Citizen and must currently possess and maintain an active TS/SCI security clearance with polygraph.24/7 shift coverage is required and may include up to 12 hour shifts, rotating shifts, 3, 4, or 5 day work weeks, and may change based on the needs of the business. This position may involve a night shift. Travel may be required up to 10% of the time. This position requires the ability to lift up to 40 lbs. and work in a cramped and/or elevated environment.This position receives a one-time, Relocation Bonus of $22K**Disclaimer: additional relocation will not be offered for these roles. The Relocation Bonus is intended to cover any relocation expenses and provide a larger upfront incentive for new Employees. This lump sum will be paid out within first 30 days of employment and is subject to applicable tax.Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.Work/Life BalanceWe value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud. Mentorship & Career GrowthWe have a career path for you no matter what stage you’re in when you start here. We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional

DESCRIPTION: DESCRIPTIONAt Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. The Transportation Operations Management (TOM) team is looking for Academy Trainers who are passionate about training and developing a growing network of Transportation Associates (TA). As an Academy Trainer, you are responsible for facilitating and executing the instructor-led onboarding experience through TOM’s Nodal Onboarding Academy (NOA) - a program with strategic significance and high exposure. The NOA provides a consistent, reliable, onboarding and learning experience for TAs using a nodal approach; training associates within close proximity using a centralized location and trainer population. You will facilitate courses on various topics to include but not limited to safety, yard, driving, and operations-based content using a mix of technologies and media platforms. As an Academy Trainer, your main mission is to efficiently onboard and comprehensively develop TAs to be successful in their new role upon Day One from graduation.The pay range for this position in Colorado is $21.01 - $36.78 per hour; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Amazon's internal or external careers site.Key job responsibilities• Organize and deliver the instructor-led onboarding experience for Transportation Associates.• End-to-end ownership of procurement of Academy supplies: purchasing supplies, tracking shipping of supplies, keeping inventory of supplies, and securing supplies at Academy sites.• End-to-end ownership of Academy logistics: room configuration and setup, associate permissions, coordination with recruitment and Day One communication, labor tracking, and ownership of non-classroom NOA training exercises (Hostler, in-yard on-the-job training, defensive driving training)• Create an engaging learner experience using various training strategies and adult learning methodologies as measured through associate feedback and post-training surveys.• Facilitate a formalized Train-the-Trainer program when developing and onboarding new trainers.• Measure, assess, and document trainee performance, attendance, and competency levels throughout the NOA experience through formalized mechanisms. • Escalate performance management needs identified during the NOA experience.• Actively pursue continuous improvement through proactive identification of content, process, and efficiency gaps.• Collaborate with peer Academy Trainers to coordinate tasks and perform quality audits.• Demonstrate learn and be curious when presented new and/or modified content, technology, and standard work expectations.• Maintain professionalism and demonstrate the standards outlined in the code of conduct while maintaining a positive attitude.• Ability to travel as appropriate (50%)• Exceptional communication skills: must be a poised, confident and engaging presenter/instructor• Strong ability to engage with others
